Amelia is asking for a loan so she can purchase materials she needs for making Ocoshal handicrafts, such as needles and thread, as well as soap and bleach for washing the pine fibers.  She weaves the fibers into baskets, tortilla baskets, breadbaskets, vases, mats, jewelry boxes, and many other items.  

Amelia is also going to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticide in order to improve the quality of her avocado trees.  She says that even though her trees are small right now, she expects to get her first avocado crop in December and will definitely earn a profit from her trees.  Amelia is excited about the loan because it will allow her to improve the quality of her avocados.  She hopes to use the profits from her first crop to purchase a pump for bringing water up to her land, since she has difficulty walking up the hill carrying buckets of water and then watering her trees by hand.

The other three members of the group are María Leucadia, Irma, and María Crisanta.  Like Amelia, they are also going to use their shares of the loan to purchase supplies for growing avocados as well as materials for making Ocoshal handicrafts.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing avocados such as fertilizer and insecticide, and to purchase materials for making Ocoshal handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Flasiah

texts.en: Flasiah is married and has four children. She practices arable farming to earn a living. She also does dairy farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. Flasiah hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en: Bienvenido is a 52-year-old married man with three children. He lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his family. He has had a tricycle business for eight years now. He earns 5,000 PHP per month transporting people around his community. Bienvenido works hard to provide for his family and to send his children to school. He requested this loan to purchase tricycle spare parts and tires and to pay for repairs. He hopes for his income to increase and for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts and tires and to pay for repairs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 38 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like beer and soda for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like beer and soda for resale

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Iddi has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells dry food like maize and beans. 

To help expand his business, Iddi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce like maize for resale and will help Iddi to generate greater profits and add more working capital for his business. Iddi hopes that in the future he will be able to become a big supplier in town. 

Iddi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Iddi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, both attending school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Beatrice has been selling clothes, shoes, and kitchenware door-to-door, a business she has operated for the last three years. She dreams of opening a wholesale business in future. Other sources of income include earnings from her husband. Seasonality is her challenge. 

Beatrice plans to use the loan of Ksh 10,000 to purchase stock of shoes, clothes, and kitchenware.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes, clothes, and kitchenware.

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedica a un taller de estructuras metálicas y tambien presta sus servicios como motorista, aprendió como ayudante luego empezó a instalar su propio negocio de estructuras, se compro su propio vehículo y tiene una experiencia de 2 años. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de hierro para el taller, ya que está realizando unos trabajos que le han solicitado, tambien le hará reparaciones al vehículo en el cual se transporte con sus trabajos, con este préstamo podrá mejorar la disponibilidad de hierro en el negocio, y darle al vehículo el mantenimiento necesario. 
Su objetivo es mejorar sus condiciones y la capacidad del taller, para poder estabilizar los ingresos a la familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and one son.  He works in a metal workshop that creates metal frames and he also lends his services as a driver.  He started as an apprentice and then later began establishing his own business of constructing metal frames.  He bought his own car and has 2 years of experience in the industry.  

He is asking for a loan to purchase iron for his metal workshop which he needs to finish some of the projects that have been requested of him.  He will also repair the vehicle he uses to transport his projects.  With this loan he will be able to improve his business by increasing the amount of iron available as well as give his vehicle the necessary maintenance.  

His objective is to improve the conditions and the capacity of the iron workshop in order to stabilize his family's income.

loans.use: tp purchase iron for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Espiga Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama espiga y se integra de tres  personas, cada uno se dedica a su respectiva actividad y todos ellos viven en un pueblo llamado Luis Espinoza.

     Virginio  quien está casado con la señora  Elisa con quien procreo un hijo que aún está a su responsabilidad y estudia en secundaria.

   El solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de madera para elaborar muebles como son: sillas, comedores, roperos, entre otros en donde lleva trabajando  veinte años y cinco meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado saliendo adelante con su familia que es lo más importante para él.

   Inició con esta actividad desde muy joven ya que aprendió de chalan (ayudante) y con el tiempo decidió  poner su propia carpintería, en donde pudiera obtener su propios ingresos y le va bien.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo él pueda seguir trabajando y dando trabajo a otras  personas que le ayudan a lijar y barnizar los muebles.

    Quienes integran en el grupo son:

   Enrique quien invertirá en barnices y madera para su carpintería y la señora Josefa invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Espiga," and it is made up of 3 people who each have their own businesses.  They all live in the town called Luis Espinoza.  Virginio is married to Elisa, and together they have a son who is still in their care and is in middle school.  He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wood to make furniture, such as: chairs, dining tables, armoires, and other items.  He has been doing this work for 20 years and 5 months, and he comments that it is going well, because with this business he has been able to get ahead with his family, and for him, this is the most important thing.

He started doing this work when he was very young, because he learned this trade from a skilled tradesman.  Eventually, he decided to establish his own carpentry workshop where he could obtain his own income, and it is going very well for him.

What he wants is that with this small business and this loan, he will be able to continue to work and provide work for other people who help him to sand and varnish the furniture.

The members of this communal bank are:  Enrique, who will invest the loan in varnishes and wood for his carpentry business, and Josefa, who will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to buy wood to use making furniture

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 54 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his health clinic which sells medicine. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for the clinic for resale, and will help John to generate greater profits in his business. John hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another clinic. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for the clinic for resale

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, la vivienda es familiar, hace 20 años su padre le heredo la panadería, hasta el momento la administra bien, continuando la producción y manteniendo la clientela.
El solicita un préstamo porque necesita realizar la reparación del horno comprándose algunos repuestos y tambien comprara materia prima como la harina, azúcar, levadura, y otros. Este préstamo le ayudara a solventar la necesidad de reparar el horno industrial y tambien disponer de materiales para la producción.
El objetivo de José es prosperar en el negocio, en un futuro comprarse otro vehículo para distribuir el pan.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and their two children, who are 9 and 6 years old, in their family home. Twenty years ago he inherited a bakery from his father. Up to this point he has run the business well, continued the production and also maintained the customer base. 

He has requested a loan because he needs to make a repair to his oven and also needs to buy raw materials like flour, sugar, yeast and other ingredients. This loan will help him resolve the issue of repairing his oven and also make available the materials he needs for production. 

Jose's goal is to improve the business and in the future buy another vehicle to distribute bread.

loans.use: to repair his oven and to buy flour, sugar, yeast and other ingredients.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2007. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business more and employ people.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and salt.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio is a 52-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has seven children. Dionesio supports his family through fishing. He needs additional capital to sustain his business. He plans to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other materials. Dionesio hopes for his fishing business to become successful. He also hopes to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other materials

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Estrellas y está conformado por ocho personas trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de engrandecer sus  negocios.
Las personas de  este grupo son originarias de Jamiltepec, Oaxaca donde  la mayoría de sus ciudadanos hablan  el idioma mixteco.
Las comidas típicas de la región son la barbacoa, mole y tamales de iguana.
algunas de sus artesanías son: son los catarros ollas y cómales entre la decorativa encontramos quemadores de copal y figuras de animales.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Esther de veintinueve años de edad, una señora trabajadora y alegre.
Doña Esther se dedica a la venta y elaboración de blusas artesanales y a la elaboración de pantalones, vestidos y batas de tela.
Comenta que  lleva bordando cinco años y cosiendo diez años, le gustan mucho sus negocios por que hace lo que más le gusta.
Tiene dos hijos Alexis y Ander sus mas grandes tesoros, es madre soltera pero con su negocio les ha podido dar una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Donde tiene mas trabajo es el 15 de febrero que es la fiesta del pueblo ya que las señoras van para que les haga su traje.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para la elaboración de blusas batas como son manta, listones hilos de colores, botones y manta de color.
Las otras integrantes  del grupo son:
Maria Flora- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Resalia- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Agustina- se dedica a la venta de artesanías.
Margarita Teresa- se dedica a la venta de pescados.
Leovigilda- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ondina- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Bernardo- se dedica a la venta de carnes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos para que  su vida mejoren y puedan  engrandecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Estrellas [The Stars], and consists of eight hard-working and humble people who wish to enlarge their businesses.
The people in this group are from Jamiltepec, Oaxaca, where most of the citizens speak Mixtec [an indigenous language].
The typical food in the region includes barbecue, mole [dishes made with a chile sauce], and iguana tamales.
Some of the local crafts are: cooking pots and griddles, along with decorative copal burners and animal figures.
One of the group’s members is Esther, who is twenty-nine years old. She is a happy and hard-working woman.
Esther makes and sells hand-crafted blouses, and she also makes pants, dresses, and cloth dressing gowns.
She says that she has been doing embroidery for five years, and sewing for ten years. She likes her business because she is doing the thing she enjoys most.
She has two children, Alexis and Ander, who are her biggest treasures. She is a single mother, but her business has helped her to be able to provide her children with a better life.
She has more work during the town festival of February 15 since women ask her to make outfits for them.
She has requested the loan to purchase more merchandise so she can make blouses and dressing gowns. Some of these items are cloth, ribbons, colored thread, buttons, and dyed cloth.
The other members of the group are:
Maria Flora – she sells embroidery
Resalia – she sells Mexican sweets
Agustina – she sells handicrafts
Margarita Teresa – she sells fish
Leovigilda – she sells food
Ondina – she sells food
Bernardo – he sells meats
They are thankful to the Foundation for helping them to improve their lives and to be able to enlarge their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hand-crafted clothing.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora runs a sari-sari store in Talibon, Bohol. She is able to provide for her family's daily needs with her income. Dioscora needs additional capital for her business. She plans to buy more merchandise (such as canned goods and softdrinks) to sell. Dioscora is hoping for her sales and profitability to increase so she can continue covering family expenses. She also hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (such as canned goods and soft drinks) to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a sari-sari store owner living in the town of Talibon, Bohol, with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Anabelle sells items such as toiletries, canned goods, coffee, sugar, and noodles. She helps in providing for her family's basic needs. She also supports her husband's fishing by selling his catch at the market. Anabelle plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets and additional merchandise to sell. She hopes to earn more and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and has three children.  He runs a tailoring business to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eight years.  He has employed one person.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ more people.  He has requested 60, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида женщина в возрасте 29 лет трудолюбивая,ответственная женщина,замужем, и имеет двоих детей.Так как у нее нету образования и она не где не работает она решила заняться откормам скота и уже этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет.Фарида знает все трудности и приимущество этого бизнеса.Дома у нее имеется 2  коровы и теленок. В связи с переходом на летний сезон клиентка хочет на полученный кредит закупить скот,и откормив  их хочет продать за хорошую цену.Она надеется на вашу помощь и заренее благодарит.
texts.en: Farida is a 29 year old woman, she is hardworking and responsible, married and has two children. She does not have education and does not work anywhere, so she decided to start feeding cattle and has been in this business for more than six years. Farida knows all the difficulties and advantages of this business. She has two cows and a calf. With the transition into the summer season she wants to use the received loan to buy livestock and then sell for a better price after feeding it. Farida hopes for your help and is thanking in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Francis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand more in his business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with 6 children aged between 9 and 24 years old. She and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Esterlita then sells his catch at the market. She also provides tailoring services to her community to help augment the family income.

Esterlita is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and tailoring materials. She hopes to have sufficient income to sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and tailoring materials

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
Bertha es una señora que se considera una persona positiva, triunfadora y muy responsable. Vive con sus dos hijos en Latacunga que se encuentra en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Bertha trabaja sola en su hogar en la compra venta de cerdos, negocio que le ayuda a sustentar algunos gastos de su hogar, al momento tiene algunos cerdos que estan en proceso de engorde, el crédito que solicita a Fodemi es para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos para crianza y reproducción, debido a que estos tienen mucha demenda en el mercado, también el crédito utilizará en la construcción de corrales para sus animales y en la alimentación como balanceado. Este proceso ayudará a Bertha a tener más cerdos en su haber y poder criarlos para su posterior venta que a su vez generará un incremento en sus ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.

Bertha sueña en tener más cerditos para que sus hijos sigan con el negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha is a woman who is known as a positive, successful and very responsible person. She lives with her two children in Latacunga, which is located in the Province of Cotopaxi.

Bertha works alone at her home buying and selling pigs. This business helps her cover some expenses of her household. At the moment, she has some pigs which are in the process of being fattened up. The loan she is requesting from FODEMI is to buy piglets of the white pig variety to raise and breed, because there is great demand for these on the market. She will also use the loan in the construction of pens for her animals and to buy feed such as commercial balanced feed. This process will help Bertha have more pigs in her business and be able to raise them for later sale, which in turn will generate an increase in her income, so that she can improve the quality of life for her loved ones. 

Bertha's dream is to have more piglets so her children can continue the business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and breed, and also to construct pens for them.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, 34 years old, is married and has a 10-year-old child. She provides manicure and pedicure services to her community. Catherine does not have her own salon yet and provides her services by visiting her customers' homes. She requested a loan to purchase a manicure and pedicure kit. Catherine hopes to have sufficient capital to start her own salon in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a manicure and pedicure kit

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and has two children. She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years. She has employed one person in her business. 

She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business in the future. Martha has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a fishing business with her husband. She sells fresh fish and crabs at her town's market. She also makes dried fish to sell. Marites works hard to increase their daily income and sustain her family. She requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and crab traps. Marites hopes for her family to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and crab traps

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix supports his family through fishing. He has been a fisherman for 10 years now. Felix needs additional capital for his fishing business. He plans to purchase a boat engine. Felix hopes to have increased business profitability. He hopes to pay his obligations, provide for his family's needs and pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en: Adelia started her sari-sari store business 5 years ago. She sells snack foods, spices, vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods. Each month, Adelia earns 4000 PHP selling various products to her community. She provides for her family's daily needs and finds difficulty in replenishing her inventory rapidly. She requested a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods and snacks. Adelia is hoping for increased sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch at the market. She also sells home-cooked meals to her community. 

Anecita wants her income to increase so she can cover the expenses in their household. She requested a loan to purchase cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices. 

Anecita hopes her food business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladis, es comerciante de bisutería, vive con su hija en casa propia, Gladis es pensionada, tiene tres años en el negocio fabricando aretes, collares, pulseras de manera artesanal.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales, como piedras, dijes, alambre, broches, tenazas para realizar el proceso, esto le ayudara a mejorar la oportunidad de producir, manteniendo lo mas surtido para la clientela.
Su aspiración es crecer, ampliarse en la zona con más clientes, instalar un puesto fijo dentro del mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Gladis' business is selling jewelry.  She is a pensioner, lives with her daughter, and owns her own home.  For three years she has been in business making earrings, necklaces and bracelets by hand.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as stones, charms, wire, clasps and pliers so that she can continue in her work.  This will help her to improve her production and have as much stock available for her customers as she can.

Gladis' goal is to grow in her business and expand in her area, attracting more customers.  She would like to have a fixed sales location within the town market.

loans.use: to buy stones, charms, wire, clasps and pliers

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en: Darwin is a 33-year-old married man with 4 children ages 6, 8, 10 and 13. He runs a sari-sari store business where he sells items like noodles, coffee, sugar, soy sauce and canned goods. He also provides prepaid mobile load to his community. Darwin works hard to sustain his family. It is his dream to send his children to school and finish a degree. He requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, snacks and prepaid mobile load. This will help increase Darwin's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, snacks and prepaid mobile load

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa, 46 years old, is married and has 3 children aged 8, 11 and 16. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for 3 years. Gaudiosa earns 7,000 PHP per month selling various items such as toiletries, canned goods and snack foods. Gaudiosa hopes for her income to increase and to be able to sustain her children's education. She requested a loan to purchase canned goods, noodles and other merchandise to sell. Gaudiosa hopes for this loan to help increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ma. Gelinda

texts.en: Ma. Gelinda and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells her husband's catch at the market and also processes dried fish to sell. Ma. Gelinda works hard to sustain her family and keep her 6 children in good health. She requested a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters. She hopes that this loan will help increase their income and be able to provide for all their needs.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Steven has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed, and will help Steven to generate greater profits and increase more capital in the business. Steven hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Steven is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Steven who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. The area is located along the road linking two Kenya cities and is often visited by many traders. She is a married mother of four children and runs a retail shop that has been in operation for the last five years. She started the business from her own savings.

Dama was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock such as flour, beans, salt, sugar, etc.

Dama is optimistic that the income from this loan will help her pay for her children's education. The challenge has been the high cost of materials, a situation she hopes to resolve by purchasing the items in bulk. 

Her future ambition is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail stock such as flour, beans, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of cosmetics, e.g. oils, shampoos, ladies' braids etc.

loans.name: Hansel

texts.en:
Hansel is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has 2 children, aged 1 and 4. Hansel provides for his family through his fishing. He works hard to increase his daily income and to cover the family's household expenses. He plans to raise pigs to help augment his income.

Hansel is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets and hooks, and piglets to raise. He hopes to have a stable income that would help him provide for his family's needs and save for his children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and hooks, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. The area is located along the road linking two Kenyan cities and is often visited by many traders. She runs a fish and vegetable shop that has been in operation for the last ten years. She started the business from the sale of farm produce.

Asha was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase additional stocks of foodstuffs such as fish, tomatoes, vegetables, etc. Asha believes that the income from this loan will help her start payments for a plot of land she intends to own. Her future ambition is to own a wholesale cosmetics center.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of foodstuffs such as fish, tomatoes, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is 28 years old and is a married woman with five children between the ages of 5 and 11. Her husband is a fisherman.

Kimberly runs a sari-sari store (general store) in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items like snack foods, vinegar, soy sauce, and canned goods. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. Kimberly has requested this loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell in her store, such as canned goods and toiletries. She hopes for their businesses to grow and for her children to finish college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more items to sell in her store, such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 100 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tilla

texts.ru:
Тилле 57 лет, вдова. Тилла с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тиллы,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы с приплодом, и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тилла обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Тилла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Tilla is 57 years old, she is a widow. Since 1995 Tilla has been doing animal husbandry, a business she started with 50,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Tilla's business now has two cows with calves and ten heads of small horned cattle and the sale of milk and dairy products brings aroung 12,000 som a month. With the goal to further grow her business Tilla has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS to buy additional heads of cattle. She plans to use the income from the loan to further increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. The area is located along the road linking two Kenyan cities and is often visited by many traders. Dennis is the father of two children. He runs a transport business; he owns a motorcycle which he uses to transport people and goods. The regions around the area lack a reliable road network and motorcycles provide a convenient means to travel for business errands. Dennis was previously employed, saved money and moved on to start the business.

Dennis was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase another motorcycle. Dennis believes the income from this loan will help him meet his family's needs. His future ambition is to own a motorcycle spare parts shop.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Shukrani

texts.en:
Shukurani lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. The area is located along the road linking two Kenyan cities and is often visited by many traders. Shukurani is a single businessman. He owns a barber shop which has been in operation for three years. He received the capital from a contribution by family members. Shukurani also intends to set up a salon.

Shukurani was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase materials such as dryers, basins, shampoo, etc. for the salon. Shukurani believes the income from this loan will help him purchase other equipment needed for the salon. His future ambition is to own a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as dryers, basins, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: La Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Guadalupana está conformado por ocho personas trabajadoras, humildes e indígenas.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado San Pedro Amuzgos, Oaxaca tierra de bordados, todas las personas de esa localidad se dedica a elaborar artesanías  hacen lo que son  vestidos, huipiles y batas artesanales vestimenta  típica de la región.
Nos cuentan que anteriormente  en su localidad no había hilos para tejer así que los hombres cendraban los  algodones  para poder sacar los hilos para que sus mujeres tejieran, hoy en la actualidad los hombres de amuzgos también tejen y bordan.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señora Socorro de cuarenta y dos años de edad, Doña Soco, como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: quesadillas, entomatadas, sopes, tacos dorados  y empanadas de pollo.
Dice que anteriormente  se dedicaba a la venta e paletas llevaba vendió  siete años pero dejo de vender por  falta material para la elaborar las paletas  desde hace cuatro meses ya no elabora sus riquísimas paletas.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor José con quien tienen dos hijos Juan Daniel e Irais Concepción  sus hijos  es su más grande tesoro.
Uno de sus sueños es que vuelva a funcionar su peletería  para poder generar más empleos en su comunidad  ya que cuenta con  carros repartidores de paletas y les da trabajo a los niños en las tardes, y les vende  paletas a las señoras para que vayan a vender en las escuelas. 
Pidió el crédito para comprar más maquinas para elaborar paletas y  también va a poder reacondicionar su local.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les da a todas las mujeres  indígenas y trabajadoras.
Las integrantes de este grupo son
Guadalupe Claudia- se dedica a la venta y elaboración de artesanías.
Norma- se dedica a la venta de 
Rosalia – se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Dora- se dedica a la venta de Internet.
Jose- se dedica a la venta  de dulces.
Rosa- se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Macrina- se dedica a la venta de pan.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por apoyar a las personas trabajadoras e indígenas.
texts.en:
This group is called La Guadalupana and is made up of eight hard-working, unassuming, indigenous people.

The members of this group are from a small village called San Pedro Amuzgos which is located in Oaxaca, the land of embroidery.  All the people in this town make embroidered goods: dresses,'huipiles' (traditional dresses) and embroidered robes, traditional clothing of the region.  They tell us that, in the past, there were no threads for weaving so the men would grow cotton so that their wives could use the thread to weave.  Nowadays, Amuzgos men also weave and embroider.

One of the members of this group is 42-year-old Socorro.  Soco, as she is better known by her fellow group members, has a business selling Mexican snack food such as quesadillas, entomatadas, soups, fried tacos and chicken empanadas.  She says that she used to sell 'paletas' (ice pops made from fresh fruit).  She did this for seven years but stopped because she lacked the materials she needed to make her ice pops.  She hasn't been making her delicious ice pops for four months.

Soco is happily married to José and the couple have two children: Juan Daniel and Irais Concepción.  Their children are their biggest treasure.  One of Soco's dreams is to re-open her ice pop business so that she can create more jobs in her community as she has carts from which to sell her products.  She requested this loan to buy more machines for making ice pops.  She would also like to be able to re-equip her premises.

Socorro is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they give to all indigenous and hard-working women.

The other members of this group are:
Guadalupe Claudia - who makes and sells handicrafts
Rosalia - who sells sweet treats
Dora - who sells Internet access
Jose - who sells sweet treats
Rosa - who sells groceries
Macrina - who sells bread.

The members of the group thank Fundación Realidad for supporting hard-working and indigenous people.

loans.use: to buy materials for making ice pops

loans.name: Santos Aurora

texts.es:
Santos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que a través de ellos esta superándose en su negocio y en su familia, ella comprara productos de primera necesidad para surtir nuevamente como el aceite, arroz, frijoles, pastas, pan, boquitas, pues estos productos tienen demanda, y le ayudaran a tener mayores ventas.
Su experiencia con creditos le ha ayudado a superarse, el efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, dándole una aceptación con los clientes, obteniendo mejores ganancias, con esto ha logrado apoyar mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is requesting another loan because she says that she is improving herself in her business and her family with them.

Once again she will buy basic convenience items to stock up, such as oil, rice, beans, pasta, bread, and snacks.  These products are in demand and will help her have more sales.

Her experience with loans has helped her to improve herself.  The effect of the previous loan was positive, giving her success with her customers and getting better profits.  With this she has managed to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, pasta, bread, and snacks.

loans.name: Sendy Damaris

texts.es:
Sendy, vive con su prima, la casa es familiar, no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, comenzó hace un año en el negocio, con la ayuda de su prima, este negocio le ha ayudado a mantenerse y poder cubrir sus gastos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos, arroz, carnes, vegetales, condimentos, aceite, frijoles, huevos y lácteos, todos estos productos son parte del menú que Sendy ofrece a diario a los clientes, por lo que este préstamo será un gran aporte para mejorar la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Sendy es tener un local propio, en el cual se pueda desarrollar como empresaria, aumentando la simpatía con los clientes.
texts.en:
Sendy lives with her cousin in the family home; she does not have children.  She sells food and started the business a year ago with her cousin’s help.  This business has helped her support herself and be able to cover her expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to buy raw materials to make her food: rice, meat, vegetables, condiments, oil, beans, eggs and dairy products.  All of these products form part of the menu Sendy offers daily to her customers so the loan will be a great contribution to improve customer service.

Sendy’s goal is to have her own locale where she can develop as a businesswoman becoming more liked by her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, condiments, oil, beans, eggs and dairy supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, el aprendió la agricultura por medio de su familia, tiene 6 años de estar trabajando, pues este a sido su medio para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales que son necesarios para realizar el cultivo como lo es el abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada también pagara el alquiler del terreno, este préstamo será de gran ayuda para Juan, porque ampliara la superficie donde sembrara, también espera aumentar la producción de maíz. 
El objetivo de Juan es darle continuidad a su trabajo y a través de el poder construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan works in agriculture; he lives with his wife and three children.  He learned agriculture from his family; he’s been working for six years and this has been his source of support for his family.

He requests a loan to buy supplies needed for the crops like manure, herbicide and improved seeds; he will also pay the land lease.  This loan will be of great help to Juan because he’ll expand the surface he plants on and will also be to increase corn production.  Juan’s objective is to give continuity to his work and through it be able to build his house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay land lease.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes tiene 45 edad esta emprendedora desde hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio  son con esfuerzos propios,  su mama le enseño  dicha actividad económica la elaboración de rosquillas y cosa de horno, herramienta de trabajo que le ha servido para sacar a delante con esfuerzo propio a su familia, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en leña, maíz, queso, cuajada, huevo, canela, mantequilla, leche entre otros productos indispensables. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, y llegar a tener  el servicio básico de una vivienda para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is 45 years old.  This entrepreneur has been in her current business for more than six years.  She started out on her own initiative, learning the business of making 'rosquillas' (ring-shaped pastries) and other baked goods from her mom.  Her stove has served as a work tool which has enabled her to provide for her family through her the sweat of her own brow.  In spite of the difficulties that she has faced, she continues working in this business.

María Lourdes will invest her loan in buying firewood, corn, cheese, curds, eggs, cinnamon, butter, milk and other essential products.  She dreams of improving her house and having a home in which she can live with dignity.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, cheese, curds, eggs, cinnamon, butter, milk and other products

loans.name: Independientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama Independientes, los integrantes eligieron el nombre ya que son señoras que se independizan  para apoyarse con los ingresos de sus  hogar.

Rosaria está casa con el señor Jesús con quien procreó tres hijos, todos ellos ya están casados y viven en una localidad llamada Llano Grande. Ella solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva trabajando  un año  y ocho meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha estado trabajando muy bien y ha logrado mejorar un poco mas su  ingresos. Rosaria inició con esta actividad para apoyar a su  esposo  con los ingresos de la casa, y así también tener lo más necesario en su hogar, por eso  decidió  de dedicarse a la venta de panes en donde le va bien. Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella siga trabajando y con el préstamo  apoyarse para seguir adelante hasta que Dios le preste vida.
 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son: Iddai, quien invertirá en la compra de marranos para engordarlos y después venderlos y la señora Esther quien invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The members of the Independientes [‘Independents’] group chose their group name because they are all women who are becoming independent in order to contribute to their household income.  

Rosaria is married to Jesús and has three children, all of them married.  They live in the community of Llano Grande.  Rosaria is asking for a loan so she can purchase ingredients for making bread.  She has made bread professionally for a year and eight months now, and says it is going well, since she has managed to improve her income a little bit.  Rosaria got involved in this activity because she wanted to help her husband with the household income and meeting the family’s basic needs, and so she decided to earn money by selling bread.  Her biggest desire is to keep working in her small business, and with support from the loan she hopes to carry on as long as God gives her life.

The other members of the group are: Iddai, who will purchase pigs to fatten and then sell; and Esther, who will purchase merchandise in order to re-stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Patron San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Patrón San Jerónimo II” en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, venta de golosinas, venta de comestibles, venta de productos de belleza, algunos trabajan como profesores, empleados públicos y otros brindan servicio médicos, servicio de turismo y servicio de transportes. 
 
(La señora Adela está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Adela nació en  la ciudad de Cusco y vive donde nació. Actualmente, Adela tiene 60 años de edad y su actividad económica principal de la socia es la venta anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde a las 3 pm hasta las 8 pm de lunes a sábado. Ya son treinta años se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Adela en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por  ejemplo carne, pollo, salchicha, aceite, papa, choclo y otras cosas más. El sueño de Adela es abrir un local donde pueda vender sus anticuchos.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal para no estar presentes en la reunión). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Patrón San Jerónimo II” communal bank in the city of Cusco in Cusco Province and Department of Cusco.  This communal bank is composed of people who seek at all times opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts provide a better future for their children.  The economic activities of the members are for example: food sales, snack sales, grocery sales, beauty products sales; some work as teachers, public employees and others provide medical services, tourism services and transportation services.

(Adela is raising her hand in the picture.)  Adela was born in the city of Cusco and still lives where she was born.  She’s currently 60 years old and her main economic activity is selling anticuchos [grilled skewered meat] from place to place.  She works from 3pm until 8pm Monday through Saturday.  
She’s been in this business for 30 years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  On this occasion, Adela needs the loan to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, sausage, oil, potato, dehydrated potato and other things.  Adela’s dream is to open a locale where she can sell her anticuchos.
 
The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments in the established time frame.  (The members who appear at the bottom of the photo asked the governing board permission to be absent from the meeting.)

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province belonging to Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It’s noted for being a very tourist-oriented zone because of its archaeological sites, for its historic city center, for its scenery and for its history; it is an enchanting city in the country’s southern region.  Cusco is known as a very tourist-oriented, commercial zone, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Cundualo Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Cundualo está constituido por tres mujeres emprendedoras que día a día luchan por el bienestar de sus familias, de este grupo Ana es la presidenta debido a que se destaca por ser una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y alegre, en la fotografía Ana es la chica del medio. Ana vive con sus tres hijos cerca de la ciudad de Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi.

Ana trabaja sola en su casa con su familia en la compra, crianza y venta de animales como conejos, cuyes y pollos, los mismos que necesitan engordar para que tengan una buena aceptación de los clientes, Ana realiza un crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la  construcción de corrales y para la compra de conejos, cuyes y pollos para reproducción y crianza, este negocio permitirá cubrir los gastos que necesiten sus hijos y mejorará la calidad de vida. Las socias de Ana utilizaran el crédito en la compra de animales ya que este negocio en su ciudad es muy común y tiene rentabilidad.

Ana sueña en mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
The Cundualo group is made up of three entrepreneurial women who work hard every day in order to provide for their families.  Ana is the president of this group as she is a very responsible, hard-working and cheerful woman.  Ana is the lady in the center of the photo.  She lives with her three children near the city of Latacunga, in Cotopaxi province.

Ana works from home, together with her family, buying, raising and selling animals such as rabbits, guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens the animals so that they are well accepted by her customers.  Ana is requesting a loan from Fodemi to build pens and to buy rabbits, guinea pigs and chickens to breed and raise.  This business allows her to cover her children's expenses and to improve their quality of life.  Ana's fellow group members will use their loans to buy animals because the business is very common in their city and is profitable.

Ana dreams of improving further every day.

loans.use: to build pens and to buy rabbits, guineas pigs and chickens

loans.name: Las Camelinitas Group

texts.es: Fernanda tiene 23 años, platica que desde muy pequeña se enseño a trabajar con el barro ya que no tenía posibilidades de ir a la escuela decidió ponerse a trabajar el barro. Platica que a ella le enseño sus papas desde que era una niña la realización de artesanías, desde hace 6 años ella y su esposo empezaron su negocio propio de la artesanía en esta temporada comenta que lo que más se le vende son las mariposas y las pinta como las monarca ya que cerca de su localidad esta en santuario de la mariposa monarca, también vende las ollas para hacer las piñatas en esta temporada decembrina. Fernanda está casada con el señor Raymundo el cual es artesano y jornalero ellos tienen dos hijos la primera de nombre llamada Grisel la cual tiene 6 años y estudia la primaria, y la pequeña Jennifer de 4 años la cual estudia el jardín de niños. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de tierra (barro) brochas, leña, esmalte, pintura, greta y moldes para hacer figuras. La meta que tiene para su negocio es seguir realizando diferentes tipos de artesanías como jarros, cazuelas grandes, platos y diferentes artesanías hechas de barro. Las otras cuatro integrantes ocuparan sus créditos para la compra de material para hacer bordados artesanales, material para hacer alfarería en barro. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Araceli, Leticia, Guadalupe y Trinidad; ellas invertirán en insumos para alfarería, material para hacer bordados artesanales.
texts.en:
Fernanda, 23, relates that since she was very little she learned how to work with clay because since she didn’t have the opportunity to go to school she decided to go to work with clay.  She relates that her parents taught her since she was a little girl to do crafts and six years ago she and her husband started their own crafts business.  She says that this season what she sells the most are butterflies; she paints them like monarchs since the monarch butterfly sanctuary is located in her location.  She also sells pots to make piñatas for the December season.

Fernanda is married to Raymundo who is a craftsman and day laborer.  They have two children.  The oldest is named Grisel and she’s 6 years old and attends elementary school.  The little one is Jennifer, 4, and she attends Kindergarten.

She’s requesting the loan to buy clay, brushes, firewood, enamel, paint, grout and molds to make figurines.  Her business goal is to continue making various types of crafts like jugs, large pots, dishes and various clay crafts.

The other four members will use their loans to buy supplies to make artisanal embroidery and supplies to make clay crafts.  The four other group members are Araceli, Leticia, Guadalupe and Trinidad; they will invest in supplies for pottery and embroidery materials.

loans.use: to buy clay, brushes, firewood, enamel, grout and molds.

loans.name: Lourdes Beatriz

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos cuyas edades son 15, 12 y 4 años, Lourdes trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos sola, ya que el padre de ellos la abandono y desde ese momento se ha convertido en padre y madre para ellos y por ello Lourdes da la vida para darle lo mejor y sobre todo criarlos en un hogar con amor y buenos principios. Cuando ella tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión al lado de sus pequeño, especialmente programas de comedia, también le gusta cocinar, sobre todo su ´platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Con mucho entusiasmo y sobre todo alegría Lourdes trabaja en su negocio de venta de pollo broster, salchipapas y hamburguesas, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, también alquila un vehículo para taxi, especialmente en horas de la mañana; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazón para la preparación de sus platillos y también porque es una persona respetuosa.

Lourdes está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar unas llantas nuevas para su vehículo y también realizara un mantenimiento general; de esta manera ella podrá seguir alquilando su vehículo y estará en buenas condiciones, así mejoraran sus ingresos y ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
45-year old Lourdes has three children aged 15, 12, and 4. She is a single mother and works very hard to help the family get ahead. Their father left her and since that time, she has been both mother and father to the children. She provides them with the best she can, and above all she raises them in a home where there is lots of love and standards are high. When she has free time, Lourdes likes watching television with her children, especially comedy shows. She also likes cooking, especially her favourite dish arroz con pollo (chicken with rice).

Lourdes is enthusiastic and happy in her work selling roast chicken, hot dogs and fries, and hamburgers. She spends about six hours a day at work and serves up to fifteen customers in that time. She also rents  out a vehicle to use as a taxi especially in the morning hours. Lourdes says the fast food business is going well because she is friendly with the customers, the food is flavorsome, and she is a respectful person.

Lourdes is very grateful to Kiva donors and thanks them for all the help she has received. With the loan she will buy new tires for the vehicle and have it serviced. Then she will be able to continue renting it out as it will be in good repair. Her income will increase too. She will be able to work for a long time and fulfill her dreams of providing her children with a good education and opening a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy new tires and have her vehicle serviced

loans.name: Angela Cecilia

texts.es:
Angela es una joven de 27 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 4 meses al cual ama muchísimo y cada vez que ve su carita le da ánimos para seguir y se da cuenta de que no puede dejarse vencer y por ello trabaja mucho para darle lo mejor y sobre todo con mucho amor y cariño. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima calido, asi como tambien se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodon. Cuando Angela dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta salir a pasear con su pequeño y en ocasiones le gusta preparara uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería, por ello se esfuerza mucho para que su hijo sea mejor que ella.

Con mucho entusiasmo día a día Angela trabaja en su negocio de venta de hamburguesas, salchipapas, pollipapas, entre otros, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 6 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y por ello los clientes siempre se sientes a gusto con sus platillos.

Angela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una vitrina y una congeladora, de esta manera ella podrá exhibir sus platillos con mas higiene y conservar los insumos que utiliza para la preparación de manera correcta, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y podrá seguir adelante luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación y una buena calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Angela is a young woman of 27.  She is the mother of a 4-month-old baby who she loves very much.  Every time she sees his little face, she is encouraged to continue in her work, realizing that she cannot give up.  She works very hard so that she can provide her son with the best in life.  Above all, she provides him with a lot of love and affection.  Angela's home is located in Parcona district.  This area is noted for its warm climate and its agriculture, above all its cotton production.  Whenever Angela has any free time she likes going out for walks with her little one and she enjoys preparing one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious 'arroz con pollo' (chicken and rice).  Owing to her parents' lack of financial means, Angela only managed to study to high school level.  However, she would have liked to have gone on to study nursing.  For this reason, she works hard so that her son can do better than she did.

Angela works enthusiastically every day in her business selling burgers, salchipapas (sliced sausages and fries), pollipapas (shredded chicken and fries) and other products.  She works around six hours a day and can serve up to thirty customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because her food is very tasty.  For this reason, her customers are always happy with the dishes she makes.

Angela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a display case and a freezer cabinet.  This will enable her to display her dishes more hygienically and she will be able to preserve the supplies that she uses to prepare her dishes correctly.  In this way, she will be able to improve her income and continue working hard so that she can achieve her biggest dream: to provide her son with a good education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a display case and a freezer cabinet

loans.name: Sonia Fabiola

texts.es:
Sonia se describe como una persona responsable, trabajadora y positiva, tiene 43 años vive con sus tres hijos en la ciudad de latacunga en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Sonia se dedica a comprar, criar y vender animales como cerdos, negocio que le ayuda a sustentar los gastos de su hogar debido a que es la única fuente de dinero, es por eso que necesita incrementar sus ventas e ingresos ya que su situación económica no está bien, para lo cual realizó un crédito en Fodemi el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de crías de cerdo blanco, para engorde y venta, proceso que incrementará el número de animales y posteriormente buenos ingresos,  al momento cuenta con 6 cerditos que estan por cumplir el tamaño y peso correcto para la venta.

Sonia sueña con seguir con su negocio y que crezca hasta poder llegar a distribuir a empresas grandes.
texts.en:
Sonia describes herself as a responsible, hard-working and positive person.  She is 43 years old and lives with her three children in the city of Latacunga, in Cotopaxi province.

Sonia's business is buying, raising and selling animals such as pigs.  This business helps her to cover her household expenses and is her only source of money.  She needs to increase her sales and her income because her financial situation is not very good.  She has requested a loan from Fodemi to invest in buying white piglets to fatten and sell.  This will increase her number of animals and will make her good income.  She currently has six piglets which have yet to reach the correct size and weight to be offered for sale.

Sonia dreams of continuing in her business and growing her business so that she can eventually distribute her animals to large companies.

loans.use: to buy white piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: La Gran Alianza Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “La Gran Alianza” en la ciudad de Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de insumos de comida, venta de comida, venta de comestibles, venta de productos de belleza, crianza de animales menores, venta de colchas, venta de muebles de madera, algunos trabajan en la confección de ropa y elaboración de muebles de madera y otros trabajan como profesores.   
 
(La señora Modesta está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Modesta nació en  el distrito de Pomacanchis de la provincia de Acomayo del departamento del Cusco. La socia Modesta desde los 8 años vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y le encanta la ciudad.  Actualmente, Modesta tiene 40 años edad es viuda pero tiene cinco hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Modesta es la venta golosinas de forma ambulatoria en una de las arterias más concurridas por lo pobladores de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son tres años se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Modesta en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como galletas, dulces, cigarros y otros más. El sueño de Modesta es sacar profesional a sus hijos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidio permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal para llegar tarde a la reunión). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “La Gran Alianza” (The Great Alliance) communal bank in the city of Cusco.  This communal bank is composed of people who seek at every moment opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts provide a better future for their children.  The economic activities of the members are for example: food sales, food ingredients sales, grocery sales, beauty products sales, animal husbandry, bedspread sales, wood furniture sales; some work sewing clothes and making wood furniture and other work as teachers.

(Modesta is raising her hand in the photo.)  Modesta was born in Pomacanchis District in Acomayo Province in Cusco Department.  Modesta has lived in the beautiful city of Cusco since she was 8 years old and she loves the city.  Modesta is currently 40-years-old, a widow, but she has five children.  
Her main economic activity is selling snacks along one of the busiest thoroughfares in the city of Cusco.  She’s been in this business for three years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  On this occasion, Modesta needs the loan to buy more merchandise like cookies, candy, cigarettes and others.  Modesta’s dream is to see her children become professionals.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments according to the established time frame.  (The member who appears at the bottom of the photo asked the governing board’s permission to arrive late at the meeting.)

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in Cusco department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It’s noted for being a very tourist-oriented zone because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the country’s southern region.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy snacks to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Don René, es casado, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, vive en un barrio del sector de Choloma, Cortes.
Tiene aproximadamente 7 años de haber iniciado su propio negocio de elaborar fajas de suela. Anteriormente trabajaba en empresa privada.  Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y lo ha mantenido estable mediante préstamos. Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 26,000.00 Lempiras para comprar materiales como cuero o suela, hebillas, remaches, hilos y otros que necesita para la fabricación de fajas, estos materiales los va comprar a otro país cercano, ya que es más barato. La mayoría de sus clientes viven fuera de la ciudad y le han solicitado producto el cual tiene que entregar. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y llegar a tener su propio local en un lugar comercial.
texts.en:
René is married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old; he lives in a neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.

He started his own business about 7 years ago making leather belts.  He used to work for a private firm.  He started this business with his own funds and has kept it stable by means of loans.  

He is currently asking for a 26,000 lempira loan to buy supplies like leather, buckles, rivets, thread and others he needs to make the belts.  He will buy these materials in a nearby country because it’s less expensive.  Most of his customers live outside the city and have requested products he has to deliver.  His goal is to make the business grow and eventually have his own commercial site.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make leather belts.

loans.name: Ana Rosibel

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 7 años de edad, vive en una colonia del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Ana tiene dos años de tener una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, refrescos y otros. Y como un año de haber iniciado a realizar otra actividad de negocio la de elaborar y vender tortillas de maíz. Inicio el negocio con la ayuda de su hermana y se ha motivado a seguir porque ha obtenido ganancias que la hace sentirse independiente.

Ella solicita un préstamo por 10,000.00 Lempiras para comprar los insumos para elaborar las tortillas como es la harina de maíz y una parte para surtir la pulpería.
Su plan es seguir creciendo con sus actividades de negocio que realiza para lograr una superación familiar.
texts.en:
Ana, 29, is a single mother; she has a seven-year-old daughter.  She lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

Ana has had a small grocery store for two years where she sells basic staple items like basic grains, soft-drinks and others and a year ago she started doing another business activity: making corn tortillas to sell.  She started the business with her sister’s help and she’s been motivated to continue because she’s earned profits that make her feel independent.

She’s asking for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy ingredients to make tortillas like corn flour and part of it to stock her grocery store.
Her plan is to continue growing in the business activities she does to attain family improvement.

loans.use: buy tortilla making ingredients and stock merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy African dresses for her business

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Adiza. She is married and has two children who are 17 and 13 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she assists with his schooling and accommodations.  In 2007, Adiza established her clothing business. She began her business because she stopped at class 5 because of her health problem.  She used to assist her mother in doing business.  She later got married to a contractor who established a small stall for her. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,899,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Adiza requires a loan in order to buy 10 dozen jeans @ Le 300,000. In the future, Adiza plans to build a house, improve her family standard of living, acquire a shop, and educate her child. She is hardworking and honest. She hopes to acquire another loan after paying this loan.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen jeans @ Le 300,000.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans - 100 pieces @ Le30,000, crepe - 25 pairs @ Le35,000 and polos - 25 pieces @ Le25,000.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 60-year-old Hawa. She is married, and has four children aged 40, 35, 29 and 22 years old. In 1992, Hawa established her clothing business. She began her business because her parents wouldn't allow their female child to attend school.  She was handed in marriage at 15 years old to a businessman who introduced her to business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 20 pieces of lace material at Le 120,000 and 20 pieces of wax cotton at Le 80,000. In the future, Hawa plans to acquire a shop, build a house and also engage in agriculture activity.  This loan will help her to achieve her future plans.  She is a hardworking businesswoman.  ARD has helped her to improve her business greatly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of lace material at Le 120,000 and 20 pieces of wax cotton at Le 80,000.

loans.name: Dallanna Geraldine

texts.es:
Dallanna es una joven de 20 años de edad, es muy entusiasta y sobre todo muy optimista, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, este distrito se caracteriza porque en el se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón y maíz. Dallanna cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con ¨Pollo”. Ella estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Obstetricia.

Con el fin de apoyar en su hogar Dallanna trabaja en un local donde brinda servicios de internet, ella trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día, pero cuando son fines de semanas trabaja hasta 9 horas ya que hay más clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo amable con los clientes.

Dallanna está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar los gastos estudiar en una academia de preparación para la universidad, de esta manera ella podrá tener una preparación básica para poder postular a la universidad, así ella podrá estudiar y prepararse para lograr su gran sueño:”Estudiar en la Universidad y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Dallanna, 20, is a young, very enthusiastic but above all optimistic young woman.  She lives in Tinguiña District.  This district is noted because agriculture takes place there, especially cotton and corn growing.  When Dallanna has free time she likes to listen to music very much and above all to eat one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious ‘Arroz con Pollo.’  She studied up to fifth grade of secondary school but would have liked to have studied obstetrics.

In order to help support her home, Dallanna works in a place providing Internet access; she works about five hours a day but on weekends works up to nine hours because there are more customers.  She believes that she does well in her work because she’s very responsible and above all kind to customers.

Dallanna is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to pay to study in a college preparatory academy so that she can have the basic education needed to be able to apply to university and she will be able to study to reach her great dream: to study in the university and be her parents’ pride.”

loans.use: to pay for college preparatory courses.

loans.name: Idrissa Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Mohamed.  He is single, and has one child aged 7. He has 4 additional dependents, who are his younger brothers and sisters. He helps  with their education.

In 2000, Mohamed established his building materials business. He began his business after dropping out of school. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,900,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional cement. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to improve his business and build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cement.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is single and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Fred has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells dry food like maize flour. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products for resale, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and expand his business. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale business. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products for resale.

loans.name: Deomukasa

texts.en:
Deomukasa is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. he is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Deomukasa has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Deomukasa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale and will help Deomukasa to generate greater profits and increase his income. Deomukasa hopes that in the future he will be able to become productive and self-reliant.
