In 2012, Janine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Janine wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa, 44, is cook and she runs a small eating house in the downtown of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2006 she has been running her business; before this she used to work as a chief cook in another restaurant. 

She lives with her husband and her daughter on her plot of land in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. She has three old houses on her plot of land and she rents two of them. But lately her houses have been in very bad condition and need repairs. So she wants to take a loan to buy the building materials for the repairs of her old houses. 

She is planning to insulate the walls of her own living house first. Because it becomes very cold inside the house without wall insulation, it costs too much money for the smoky coal needed to warm the inside of the house. 

Also lack of insulation has a bad effect on the air of the city. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters, when temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F), even in the cities. Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. 

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Ariunaa is taking will be dedicated to buying building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of her house to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.use: to buy building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of her house to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.name: Khuvaido

texts.ru: Хувайдо – 29 лет, женат, имеет 3 сыновей. Он очень ответственный, трудолюбивый и пунктуальный мужчина. Занимается торговлей парфюмерной продукции. Опыт в этой деятельности более 5 лет. Хувайдо старший сын и живет вместе с родителями. Его жена не работает, она занимается хозяйством, и воспитанием сыновей. У них имеется небольшой сад. Отец Хувайдо очень хороший садовник, он присматривает за садом, ухаживает за деревьями и получает хороший урожай. Ещё у них есть домашние животные (коровы, козы, овцы) за которыми тоже ухаживает отец. Хувайдо помогает своим родителям зарабатывая самостоятельно. Ведь родители должны дать образование и обустроить остальных детей. Так как начинается свадебный сезон, на полученный кредит Хувайдо хочет увеличить ассортимент  товаров. Хувайдо и его родители выражают свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khuvaido is 29 years old, married, and has three sons.  He is a very responsible, hardworking and punctual man. He sells perfume products, and has more than 5 years of experience in this field. 

Khuvaido is the oldest son in his family and he lives with his parents. His wife is not employed; she takes care of the household and raises their sons.  

The family has a small garden. Khuvaido's father, an experienced gardener, is the one taking care of the garden, caring for the trees and growing nice farm products.  The family also owns livestock (cows, goats, sheep), and Khuvaido's father also takes care of the animals.  

Thanks to Khuvaido's help, his parents are financially independent, and can educate their grandchildren and prepare them for the future.

As it is the beginning of the wedding season, Khuvaido would like to use his loan to increase his assortment of products.  

Khuvaido and his parents are grateful for the financial support provided by our organization.

loans.use: to expand his business and increase his assortment of perfume products.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is from Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Flordeliza is married and has three children. To make a living, Flordeliza is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Flordeliza has been in her business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Flordeliza joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Selveria

texts.en: Selveria is a widow with three children. Selveria is 65 years old and lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, she sells personal products such as lotions, bras, and more. She has been operating this business for five years and earns 6,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to obtain more personal products to sell. Selveria has been a member of the cooperative since 2008. In the future, Selveria hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to expand the facility and product offerings to attract more customers.

loans.use: to obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a 55-year-old married woman with two children living in Balintawak, Aurora, Zambo. Del Sur. In order to make additional income for the family, she entered into a business planting & harvesting flowers for sale seven years ago. Margarita usually earns 5,500 PHP a month. Margarita joined GDMPC in 2011 and she borrowed 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She was able to improve her business because of the money rendered to her. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en: As a parent of nine, Hen and her husband have been growing cassava for 10 years and farming rice for 25 years to make a living. The main obstacle for her is when the price of cassava drops. Hen has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and these previous loans have helped to increase her crop yield. Hen is now leading a group of two female members to apply for another loan from VisionFund. As a leader, she plans to use this loan to spend on land plowing for her field and strongly hopes it will help to further increase her crop yield so that she can sell the products for higher prices to better feed her family.

loans.use: To pay for having her land plowed

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun is 37 years old and a married mother of two: one boy and one girl. Her two kids are still in school. To earn a living, Oun and her husband have been farming rice and selling coconuts for almost 20 years. Oun also owns a small grocery store to generate additional income. Per day, she makes about five US dollars. Oun received her first loan from VisionFund in 2011 and this loan has helped to support her family's daily expenses including food and the children's school fees. After successfully paying the first loan, Oun is now leading a group of four female members to request another loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and spend on land plowing. She hopes the second loan will enable her to make more income from her rice farming business so she can feed her family sufficiently and keep her two children in school until they are finished.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and fertilzers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Mey's Group

texts.en: Mey is 50 years and has six children, three of whom are still studying. Mey and her family live in a rural area located in Dambae district. To make a living, Mey and her family have been planting cassava for over 10 years.  Her business struggles when the price of cassava in the market drops. Mey obtained her first loan from VisionFund in 2010. Now she is leading a group of two female members to apply for another loan since her first loan has been paid. As the leader, Mey requested the loan and plans to use her portion to buy fertilizers and spend the remaining money on land plowing and labor fees. She hopes this loan will help to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor fees and fertilizers

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s local food restaurant business. He runs a small restaurant where he serves his customers local food items like “Daal chawal" (made with rice and lentils) and "Nan chanay" (made with chickpeas and served with bread). 
 
With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, and chickpeas in larger quantities to make better quality food and offer improved services to his clients He will also put some furniture in his restaurant to facilitate his clients.
 
Kalsoom is also a working lady and operates an animal sales business with her husband. Her husband purchases young animals, raises them and then sells them to butchers for a profit. Kalsoom provides full support to her husband in his business.
 
She is confident that her son will be able to improve his products and services and earn more profits from his business with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the restaurant business

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en: Jeremias is from La Victoria Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has three children. He is 32 years old. Jeremias used his last loan to purchase additional used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to buy more shoes ("okay-okay") to sell.. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is 42 years and married to Mary who helps him maintain the family. They have three children who are 22, 16 and 15 years old, respectively. He has been running his livestock feed business for six years earning KSH 22,500 monthly.   

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying back his previous loans. He is going to use the loan to purchase livestock feed for resale. He plans to uset the anticipated profits from the business to build rental houses. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a well equipped livestock feed store.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for resale.

loans.name: Geneveve

texts.en: Geneveve is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Geneveve owns and operates a farm, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Geneveve has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Geneveve plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Carmen Dinalda

texts.es:
Con 5300 pesos Carmen desea comprar inventario para alcanzar un mayor número de clientes y poder aumentar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su hija a pagar la universidad.
Carmen vende desde hace siete años accesorios  y ropa interior de manera ambulante a todos sus conocidos y vecinos de la comunicad y otros pueblos cercanos. Este es el único ingreso que hay en su casa, además de dos mil pesos que le aportan sus hijos todos los meses.
Carmen es viuda y madre de seis hijos. El mayor tiene 30 y la menor tiene 20 años. Ya todos se han casado, excepto por la menor que estudia y vive en la casa con ella.
Barranca Abajo es una comunidad muy pobre localizada en el precioso y fértil valle de La  Vega. Aunque es uno de los valles agrícolas más productivos de la República Dominicana, el nivel de pobreza en las comunidades que le rodean es muy alto. 
Carmen desea expandir su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de mercancía a sus clientes y en el futuro tener un local donde sus clientes puedan venir  a comprar.
texts.en:
With 5,300 pesos, Carmen wants to purchase inventory to gain a larger number of customers and be able to increase her income so that she can help her daughter pay for university. 

Carmen has sold accessories and under clothes door to door for seven years. She makes her sales with her acquaintances and neighbors in her community and other nearby towns. This is the only source of income in her home aside from the 2,000 pesos that her children support her with each month. Carmen is a widow and the mother of six children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 20 years old. All of them have married except for the youngest who is studying and lives with her in her home. 

Barranca Abajo is a very poor community located in the beautiful and fertile valley of La Vega. Although it is one of the most productive agricultural valleys in the Dominican Republic, the level of poverty in the surrounding communities is very high.

Carmen wants to expand her business and offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. In the future she wants to have a shop where her customers can come to make their purchases.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
El se dedica al rubro de ventas de frutas y verduras en  las ferias libres, trabaja con su esposa los días jueves y domingo, se desempeña en sus labores desde hace 8 años.
Su mercadería la compra en un abastecimiento que se especializa en vender productos de frutas y verduras.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería y arreglará su vehículo para transportar su mercadería.
Una de las metas de Julio son poder crecer en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Julio vive junto a su esposa. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y  tener un local propio.
Julio está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómodo con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Julio is a member of the communal bank "Todos Juntos", which belongs to the city of Viña del Mar.  He and his wife sell fruits and vegetables at free markets, and have been in business for eight years.

He buys his goods from a supplier who specializes in fruits and vegetables.  With the loan he will buy merchandise and repair the vehicle he uses to transport the goods.

One of Julio's goals is to expand business to earn more income so he can lead a better lifestyle.  He lives with his wife and their dream is to continue working and open their own establishment.

Julio is very happy and grateful for the loan and services he has received through Fondo Esperanza.  He says he feels very comfortable in the communal bank meetings and with the members of the group, because there is generosity and unity.

Viña del Mar is a city on the coast of central Chile.  It is also known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that many old residences in the city have.  It is also considered Chile's tourist capital.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica al rubro de comerciante, específicamente a la venta de verduras.
Juana se desempeña en sus labores de comerciante todos los días y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Con el crédito cambiara su vehículo.
Su mercadería la compra en abastecimientos de verduras para su negocio. Una de sus metas son comprar un camión para trasladarse con su mercadería a su puesto de trabajo.
Juana vive junto a su hija quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños son hacer un segundo piso en su casa, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Todos Juntos", which belongs to the city of Viña del Mar.

She is a merchant and sells vegetables.  Juana works every day and establishes her work schedule depending on her availability.  With the loan she plans to change her vehicle.  She buys goods from vegetable wholesalers, and one of her goals is to buy a truck to transport the goods to her workplace.

Juana lives with her daughter who is in school.  She wants to add a second storey to their house to give her daughter a better lifestyle.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo Esperanza, since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group, because they all share their business experiences and interests.  So it has become like a hobby for her.

Viña del Mar is a city on the central coast of Chile, also known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios the old city residences have.  It is also known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To change her vehicle.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 43 years-old and supports a family of five people. She is married to Tito who helps to provide for the family. They are blessed with five children aged between three to 21 years. Priscila is running a cereals business of buying and selling maize; she has been in operation for seven years now and has a monthly income of KES 8,000.  

She has good history with KADET LTD, this is her sixth loan of KES 85,000, after successfully servicing her previous loans. She will be using the loan to buy dry maize stock for resale.

With the anticipated profits from the cereals business, she plans to add more stock of dry maize for resale. Her hopes and dreams are to be able to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy dry maize stock for resale.

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Killa” en la ciudad de Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de ropa, algunos trabajan como profesores y otros brindan servicio de llamadas.   
 
(La señora Olga está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Olga nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Olga es la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante pero el local es alquilado y cada mes paga un alquiler. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Olga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante ósea desea comprar sillas, mesas, platos y otros más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Killa" in the city of Cusco.  This communal bank is comprised of people always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, through daily effort, provide a better future for their children.  The business activities the members are involved in include clothing sales, teaching, and phone calling services, among others.

(Mrs. Olga is the one raising her hand in the photo).  Olga was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 25 years old, has a common-law husband and three children.  Her main business activity is selling food.  She has a small restaurant in a space that she rents monthly.  For a year now she has been in business and it is going very well thanks to her hard work.  On this occasion, Olga needs a loan to furnish the restaurant with chairs, tables, dishes, etc.

The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back their loan installments on time.  Cusco is in the district, province and department of Cusco, in the heart of the old city of the Incas.  It is known for its tourist areas, archeological centers, historic center, landscape, history and because it is one of the most enchanting cities of the southern part of the country.  Cusco is very well-known for being a great tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: "Machupicchu".

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, dishes and other items to furnish her restaurant.

loans.name: Norissa

texts.en: Norissa is 27 years-old. She lives in Calamba, Philippines. Norissa owns and operates a business selling a variety of used clothes (ukay-ukay) to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,200 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Norissa joined GDMPC just this year. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Irina

texts.es: Hace un año inició su taller de confecciones Irina, una mujer que trabajó como operaria y gracias a sus ahorros, producto de su liquidación cuando dejó de ser empleada,  y a la sociedad con su prima, logró  emprender su propia aventura empresarial. Cada una de ellas aportó maquinarias y herramientas, además de su experiencia al buen desempeño del negocio. Muy pronto su estilo y distinción, fue adquiriendo reconocimiento y hoy su taller está funcionando en una habitación de su propia casa. Sus mayores deseos son tener una marca propia para ensanchar su mercado y tener un mercado menos doméstico y más tecnificado, además de poseer su propia su tienda de vestir. En la medias en que su negocio crece, Irina requiere mas capital de trabajo para hacer compras de oportunidad, que le permitan ser mas competitiva en el mercado. Esto es lo que busca al acercarse a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adquirir su credikiva,   con él comprara telas en mayor volumen e insumos como hilos y aplicaciones, para volver sus nuevos diseños toda una obra de arte y esto es justamente lo que quiere su mercado de mujeres y jóvenes principalmente.
texts.en:
A year ago, Irina set up her sewing workshop.  She worked as an operator before, and thanks to her savings and severance pay when she left her job, she was able to set up her own business with a cousin.  Each one of them brought machinery and tools, as well as expertise to the business activity.  Very soon it began to stand out because of its style and elegance, and nowadays the shop is working out of one of the rooms in her own house.

Her greatest desire is to have her own brand to expand her market into something less domestic and more technically-based.  She also wants to open her own clothing store.  As her business grows, Irina requires more work capital to take advantage of goods on sale so she can be more competitive in the market.  This is what motivated her to resort to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a CrediKiva loan.  She will use it to buy wholesale fabrics and supplies such as thread and appliqués, so she can make her new designs into works of art, which is what her women and young lady customers mainly want.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fabric and supplies such as thread and appliqués.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya is a married woman lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Darhan Province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, two elder children are school students and the younger one goes to kindergarten.  Her first business was a steel trading business; she started this business in 2010. She buys all sorts of junk steel from locals and sells it to the factories. Also, Enhtuya operates an organic dairy product sales business. She has four cows and she sells the milk to grocery stores, which are located near her business place. Her location is good and very noticeable. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "In the future, I would like have more cows to expand my business and to support my children, because soon they will be university students." She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase organic feeds for her cows.

loans.use: To purchase organic feeds for her cow.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is single. Joy is forty-five years old, and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. To earn a living Joy owns and operates a music bar. He has been in this business for five years and earns PHP 10,500 from it. 

Joy has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more drinks and food. In 2011, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Joy wants to make improvements to his house and to improve his general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and food.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is thirty years old. She hawks assorted snacks in Emali town. She is married and has three children. She has been in this business for five years. 

She intends to use this loan to purchase more stock of potato crisps and popcorn and to look for business premises. She hopes to enlarge her business and business premises from the business profit.

Her future hopes and dreams are to enlarge the business further and if possible start a wholesale business.

loans.use: To add more stock of potato crisps and popcorn for sale.

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es: Lenin con su credikiva anterior compró materias primas y con ellas elaboró monederos, llaveros, bolsos y billeteras que muy pronto vendió y ganó dinero. Él quiere continuar aumentando la producción para ensancharse en el mercado y por eso acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará nuevamente, materias primas e insumos como cueros, cuerinas, aplicaciones, telas etc, con los cuales fabricará nuevos diseños, aprovechando la alta temporada que se acerca y las posibilidades de venta se incrementa, pues en el ambiente sus clientes cuentan con primas laborales y bonificaciones y compran mucho mas. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir recibiendo el apoyo financiero, para continuar aumentando el capital, de trabajo, las ventas y las utilidades de mi negocio. “
texts.en:
Lenin used his previous CrediKiva loan to buy raw materials to make billfolds, key holders, handbags and purses which he sold quickly and earned money.  He wants to continue increasing production to expand in the market, so he is requesting a new CrediKiva which he will use again to buy raw materials and supplies such as leather, imitation leather, applications, fabric, etc. to make new designs and take advantage of the approaching high season.  This is when sales possibilities increase because customers receive extra pay and bonuses and buy a lot more.

This is why the CrediKiva is so successful.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following:  "Many thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  I hope to continue receiving their financial support so I can increase my business capital, work, sales and profits."

loans.use: To again buy raw materials and supplies such as leather, imitation leather, applications, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his butcher's shop in Nakuru town for the last six years. He is thirty-eight years old, married to Margaret, and they have four school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers during marketing in Nakuru town and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goats to slaughter and sell to boost and sustain his butcher business. 

In future, Joseph hopes to expand his butchery business and open shops in other parts of Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a 49-year-old resident of Bunawan, Calamba Mis. Occ. She provides for her three children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 that she gains monthly from her banana plantation business of three years, an aid to the income gained by her husband. This year, she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer. Eugenia wants to make an expansion to her business someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ardie

texts.en:
Ardie is married. He has two children. He is twenty-four and lives in Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Ardie operates a business butchering and selling pork in the local community. He has been in this business for three years and makes PHP 8,000 a month from it. 

He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to obtain more meat to sell. In 2010, Ardie joined GDMPC. In the future, Ardie wants to save to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to obtain more meat to sell.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest has been in the business of selling clothes in Nakuru town for the last five years. He is forty-nine years old, married to Jane, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers during marketing in Nakuru and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy additional stocks of new clothes to sell in his business.

In the future, Ernest hopes to expand his clothing business and become one of the leading clothing dealers in Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is thirty-four years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big supermarket. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Prossy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has been in the cereals and potato business in Nakuru town for the last twenty years. She is sixty-three years of age, widowed and has three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of potatoes and cereals to sell.

In future, Cecilia hopes to supply cereals and potatoes to all parts of Nakuru and get more income, thereby improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married with five children. She is thirty-five years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Lilibeth owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lilibeth is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with three children. Editha is in her forties and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Editha owns and operates a business venture, making and selling "nipa hut" products in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years and makes PHP 5,500 a month from the business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase nipa palm to make roofing materials. In 2012 Editha joined GDMPC. In the future, Editha wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase nipa palm to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is thirty-seven years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big supermarket. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is a married man who has seven children. Norberto is fifty-five years old, and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Norberto owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years and earns PHP 7,400 a month. 

He requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and pay for coconut planting. In 2011, Norberto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Norberto wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for coconut planting.

loans.name: Sreyna's Group

texts.en:
Sreyna is twenty-eight years old and a married mother of two, one boy and one girl. Both of her children are still in school. Sreyna and the family live in a house built from bamboo located in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. To support her family, for the past four years, she and her husband have been growing cassava which is a common business in her area. 

After having completely repaid her second loan to VisionFund, Sreyna is now leading a group of six members to apply for another loan. As a group leader, she plans to use this loan to cultivate her cassava plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for good money so that she can better feed and support her family and her kid's educations.

loans.use: To cultivate her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 40 years-old and is a married woman with 10 children. She and her husband run a fishing business in Panglao, Bohol. She needs additional capital to sustain their business. She plans to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and hooks. This will help bring in more fish for Arlene to sell. She hopes for her income to increase to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and hooks.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Alejandro is 49 years-old. He is married and has four children.

To make a living, Alejandro owns and operates a (habal-habal) motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month for these activities.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000, which will be used to purchase a sidecar and repair his existing vehicle for better service.

In 2011, Alejandro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a sidecar and repair existing his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jeryl

texts.en: Jeryl is married and has two children. Jeryl is 33 years-old, and resides at Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is cultivating fruit trees and harvesting its fruit for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 19,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. In 2010, Jeryl joined GDMPC. In the future, Jeryl wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-two years old, married, and with three children. She lives and works in Dandora estate where she runs a retail shop to support her family. She has been in business for the last six years. 

She plans to buy more stock for her shop so that she can increase her sales.

Mary desires to expand and grow her business and be able to get better returns. This will enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy some sugar, tea leaves, cooking floor and other food items for her shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is twenty-nine years-old and married to Jane. He hawks household items, with an estimated monthly income of twenty-six thousand only. 

He has been in the business for four years, and this being his first loan from KADET LTD, he intends to use the money for increasing the utensil stock such as dishes plates, cups, and thermos flasks.

He also plans to use the anticipated profits to open a shop in Ruaraka, thus becoming a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy dishes plates, cups, and thermos flasks.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: Shazia is married and has a son. Due to financial constraints, she is unable to provide him education. Her husband sells medicines at different medical stores. He has good knowledge of medicines and he is very efficient in his work. Shazia herself does embroidery. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. Her clientele base are her neighboring customers.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy beads, frames, and colored thread to offer better quality services to her clients. This will help her make more money from her business. She is very experienced in her business and confident about her success with this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy embroider material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Elma Marpi

texts.en:
Elma Marpi is a married woman with four children. Elma Marpi is forty-eight years old, and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Elma Marpi owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items such as cigaretes, candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. In 2011, Elma Marpi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elma Marpi wants to build house and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell such as cigaretes, candies, milo, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en: Thary lives in a wooden house located in Ponhea Krek District. She is a community doctor and has four children, three of whom are staying with the family. Thary also raises piglets to generate additional income to support her family. She earns six US dollars per day. This is the first time Thary has requested a loan from VisionFund. She plans to use this loan to buy piglets and pig feed, and hopes that those pigs can grow healthily hence allowing her to sell them for high price to better feed her family.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is fifty-four years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Ivan has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which sells chickens. 

To help expand his business, Ivan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed, and will help Ivan to generate greater profits and cater for all his family's basic needs such as paying school fees for his children. Ivan hopes that in the future he will be able to to build a residential house. 

Ivan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ivan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with five children. Susan is forty-three years old and lives in the Philippines. Susan is a farmer and she manages their coconut and banana production business. She has been doing this for six years and every month she earns PHP 8,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Susan has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Susan hopes to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old from Nakuru and is married with two children, who go to school.

Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by a fellow client and he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him buy more oranges and apples to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

In the near future, he hopes to put up a permanent house where he will operate his business from.

loans.use: To buy oranges and apples.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. 

For the past six years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. 

Fatuma hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another clothing business as another branch . 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Fatuma, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is married and has one child.  

He runs a barber shop to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business since 1992. He also earns extra income from his retail shop. He employs four people. His business has grown since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to expand his businesses and employ more people. He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike for a transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Peter Kuria

texts.en:
Peter has farmed in Njabini town for the last three years. He is 49 years old, married to Mary Wanjiku and they have three children. 

He heard about KADET through the field staff and this will be his fourth loan. He paid off his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy another dairy cow, which will increase his milk output for his customers, who are increasing daily.

In the near future, he hopes to buy a pickup, which will help him in transportation.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married and has three children. She is 52 years old and resides in Lusot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ., Philippines. 

Rosa owns and operates farming land. She plants and harvests rice to sell for a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 8,300 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping season. In 2010, Rosa joined GDMPC. 

In the future, Rosa wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping season

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is very supportive in nature and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She learned sewing skills before her marriage and now she is making full use of her skills to earn an income for her family. 

Her husband works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. 

Safia has given birth to two daughters. Both of them are also sewing experts. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to aid the further expansion of her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine, which will allow her to complete client orders on time and increase her sales and income because her current sewing machine is not up to the task. 

She is very confident that her business will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 56 years old and her children are all grown up. She has a grocery stall in Kitengela market, which she has run for the last twelve years.

She plans to add more groceries for sale, so that she can increase her income. Nancy wants to expand her business by opening another stall.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Neah's Group

texts.en:
Neah is 49 years old and is widowed with seven children, three of whom are staying with the family and still in school. 

Neah earns a living by growing cassava, which is a common business in her village in the Dambae district. The main problem for her family is not having sufficient food to eat. 

Neah first joined VisionFund in 2011. Up until now, she has obtained two loans. She is now applying for a third loan after paying the second loan off completely. As a group leader, Neah plans to use her portion to spend on land plowing and labor fees. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to generate more income, so she is able to feed her family better and send all her children to school.

loans.use: To spend on land plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married with three children. She is 51 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Rosalina owns and operates a plot of farmland; cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP each month. 

She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow. Rosalina is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Rosalina hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily used the last loan to buy hair chemicals and hair braids. Since she received the loan, she has experienced a lot of growth in her business. She has also managed to employ two people in her business.  

She hopes to open another outlet of her business and has requested another loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair treatment and hair braids.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is thirty years old and married with two children who are aged between two and one years old.

He is a tailor and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd., to enable him to buy more materials, buttons and zips for use in the business.

He hopes to see his business grow in the near future and also be able to open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy materials, buttons and zips.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thirty-eight years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past five years, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities to sell, such as soap, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to achieve more profits and get more customers. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities to sell like soap.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is thirty-five years old and married with three children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, Sorn and her husband have been growing cassava for ten years and rubber trees for a year. Per day, her family earns about five US dollars. 

Sorn has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and after successfully paying her previous obligations, she is now leading a group of two female members to request another loan. Sorn plans to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava crops and rubber trees. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow good-yield crops and therefore sell them for high price so that she has enough money to feed her family, and especially to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers for her cassava and rubber trees.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is thirty-three years old, married, and supports a family of three. He is a mobile phone technician, and has been doing phone repairs for the last eight years. His monthly income is KES 35,000.

He has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more phones and their accessories so that he can do repairs for his growing client base. 

This will boost his sales and income. The anticipated profits will be used to support his services to run smoothly. His future dreams is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase new phones and accessories.

loans.name: Flor Margarita Group

texts.es:
Las nuevas integrantes de este grupo son la señora  Lucia Maricela, Margarita  y Gloria  que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como son venta de productos naturales, paletas heladas y pollos.
La señora Gloria  tiene treinta y seis años de edad  se dedica a la venta de pollos  y a la venta de verduras desde hace dos años, dice que vende los pollos en las colonias de su comunidad.
Obtuvo su negocio comprando primeramente dos pollos y se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio y decidió comprar mas pero en una ocasión no tenia suficiente dinero para comprar una caja de pollos  y una de sus compañeras le dijo que trabaja con fundacion y para que pudiera engrandecer su negocio.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que pollo se vende muy bien y  deja buenas ganancias  y puede mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
Doña Gloria es madre soltera tiene cinco hijos José Manuel, Marisol, Rubi, Esperanza y José Antonio sus hijos para ella son sus mas grandes tesoros y su motor para trabajar cada día.
Pidió el crédito para la compra de más pollos para la venta destazados y vivos.
Dice que esta contenta por el apoyo que le ha dado fundacion para que pueda trabajar mas y obtener mas ganancias y  así darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Las integrantes de este grupo le  dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres solteras con deseos de progresar.
texts.en:
The new members of this group are Sras. Lucia Maricela, Margarita, and Gloria. They engage in different retail businesses selling natural products, frozen popsicles, and chickens.

Sra. Gloria is 36 years old and has been selling chickens and vegetables for two years. She says that she sells the chickens in the subdivisions within her community. Gloria started her business by purchasing two chickens. She realized that this would be a good venture to pursue and decided to buy more. On one occasion, she did not have enough money to buy a case of chickens. A friend suggested that she work with Fundación Realidad so that she could expand her business. What she likes most about her business is that the chickens she sells are very good and generate excellent income that will improve the life of her children.

Doña Gloria is a single mother with five children: José Manuel, Marisol, Rubi, Esperanza, and José Antonio. Her children are her greatest treasures and the motivation that drives her to work each day. She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens, butchered and live, that she can sell. Gloria says that she is pleased with the support that Fundación Realidad has given her so that she can work more, earn more income, and provide a good education for her children.

The members of this group express their thanks to Fundación Realidad for helping single women who want to make progress.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pay wages of his laborers

loans.name: Gie Keur Demba  Kahone Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "GIE Keur Demba " de Kahone est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent dans le même village.Elles exercent des activités d'élevage et d'agriculture.Elles élèvent des moutons qu'elles vendent une fois arrivés à maturité; elles vendent aussi du lait frais et du lait caillé.Concernant l'agriculture, elles ont un champs collectif dans lequel elles cultivent l'arachide.Elles se font aider par les hommes pour les travaux les plus durs mais prennent en charge l'essentiel des taches jusqu'à la récolte.La vente de leur production leur permet d'acheter une fois l'année, qui des habits neufs, qui des meubles ou des bracelets.Elles participent aussi fortement à la prise en charge des dépenses alimentaires de leurs familles.Afin de préparer l'hivernage prochain, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des semences.Elles ambitionnent d'élargir les surfaces exploitées.
texts.en: The GIE Keur Demba group in Kahone is comprised of five women living in the same village. They are all working in agriculture; some raise lambs, other sell fresh milk and buttermilk. They have a shared plot of land for growing ground nuts. They are assisted by the males in their families for the more difficult tasks, but are essentially in charge of all activities until the harvest. Profits from their sales allow them to purchase, once a year, new clothes, furniture or bracelets. They also participate actively to sharing food costs for their households. In order to prepare in advance for next winter, they are asking for a loan of 500,000 FCFA [approximately 975 USD] to purchase grains and increase their yield.

loans.use: purchase grains

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter used his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.  He made good sales, hence more profits.  He used the additional profits to add chicks to his poultry farm.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy supplies of clothes

loans.name: Cheikh Anta

texts.fr: Cheikh Anta est un homme marié , père de trois enfants.Il exerce depuis deux ans un commerce de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité.La très bonne position de sa boutique lui assure une grande clientèle.Il parvient ainsi à générer des revenus assez importants.Il utilise ces revenus pour prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille, les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des caisses de lait de beauté, de mèches et de parfum.Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en: Cheikh Anta is a married man and father of three children. For the past two years he has been selling cosmetic products at the central market in his area. The terrific location of his store assures him a large number of customers, and is thus able to generate profits. He uses these profits to take care of the needs of his family, school fees for his children and his own needs. He is asking for a loan of 500000 FCFA [approximately 975 USD] in order to purchase boxes of beauty milk, hair extensions and perfumes. He hopes to be able to open a second boutique.

loans.use: purchase boxes of beauty milk, hair  extensions and perfumes

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala north region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mark has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Mark has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Mark generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Mark hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more materials for making clothes for resale. 

Mark is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mark who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 40 years old, married to Njuguna and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of the existing clients and this is her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.) and also cater for her family's needs.

In future, Florence hopes to expand her business as well as improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married and has three children.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business since 2009.  She also does farming to supplement her income.

She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business and employ people.

She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in Kompong Cham province, Savun and her husband have been farming for ten years to support the family. She also owns a small grocery store to make additional income. Savun is 32 years old and married with one daughter. This is Savun's first loan with VisionFund.

She is now leading a group of two female members. Savun, as a leader, used her portion to spend on farmland preparation and also open a small barber shop. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to spend on farmland cultivation and open a small barber shop

loans.name: Erdenebold

texts.en:
Erdenebold is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his children are kindergarten students. 

Erdenebold started his vacuum-insulated window manufacturing business in 2010. Before he started the business, he had four years of experience working in a vacuum-insulated window factory. Since he started the business, he has become a supplier for many companies. In 2011, he opened his own vacuum-insulated company. His products are well-designed and his customers are satisfied with them.

Vacuum-insulated windows are very energy-efficient; they protect from cold in the winter and heat in the summer. Now that his business is doing well, his product demand is high. Therefore, Erdenebold needs to purchase more materials to make more energy-efficient, vacuum-insulated windows in order to meet the market demand. He's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To buy more materials with which to make energy-efficient, vacuum-insulated windows.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Maria has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Con su venta de fritos hayacas pasteles y deditos, Vicenta ha logrado obtener ingresos propios desde hace 14 años, cuando estaba recién llegada de su pueblo natal en condiciones de desplazamiento y su hijo le dio un capital semilla para que comprara el menaje de cocina y trabajara en la preparación de alimentos. Ella inició con una olla, un caldero y una mesa de madera haciendo productos fritos como arepas dulces, de queso, de huevo, empanadas, etc,  Su sueño de ampliar su negocio no se desvanece y planea continuar mejorando sus condiciones de negocio, pues requiere tener enfriador donde almacenar su materia prima, lo cual se convierte en un gran desafío porque aumenta su diario trabajo haciéndola menos eficiente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva con el cual comprará su refrigerador y con el logrará mayor efectividad y ahorrará tiempo que invertirá en la búsqueda de nuevos mercados para continuar creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de bienestar en su calidad de mujer y viuda .
texts.en: By selling fried food, hayaca (cornmeal, meat and vegetables wrapped in banana leaves), pies and cheese fingers, Vicenta has been generating her own income for 14 years. When she first started, she had just been forced to move from her home village; her son provided her with seed capital to buy a full set of kitchen appliances and launch a food-making business. She started with a pot, a cauldron and a wooden table: with these she made fried products such as cornmeal rolls filled with sugar, cheese, or eggs, as well as empanadas and others. She still dreams of expanding her business and she plans on improving her equipment, since she needs a fridge in which to store her raw ingredients. The lack of one is a challenge because it means more work every day and thus less efficiency. Thus she asks for a Kiva loan in order to buy a fridge. It will enable her to be more efficient and to save time, which she will use to look for new markets in order to keep growing and to improve her living conditions as a woman and a widow.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a fish vendor from Panglao, Bohol. She is a married woman with six children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Evelyn and her husband work hand-in-hand to sustain their business and family. Fishing has been the main source of their income ever since they got married. 

Evelyn does her best to increase her daily income and attend to her children as well. She applied for this loan to purchase fishing nets, iceboxes and more fish to sell. Evelyn hopes that this loan will help increase her business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, iceboxes and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Meriam works hard to support her family.

Meriam has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Meriam is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build her business, thus securing the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 42 years old and lives in the town of Natete in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past six years, Resty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells commodities such as sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as salt for resale. This will help Resty to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business to a supermarket. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Resty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as salt for resale in her store.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 26-year-old single mother with one child. She has been running her retail shop for a period of about one year with an income of about KES 13,950 a month. 

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd., and she wants to use it to buy more stock of soft drinks, bread and washing detergent for sale in her shop. 

She hopes to expand her business and own a wholesale business and give her child a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 33 years old and has a 6-year-old child. She runs a carinderia (eatery) in Panglao, Bohol. Early in the morning, Felisa prepares local dishes to sell during lunchtime. She also makes snacks that she sells in the afternoon. 

She requested this loan to purchase cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices. 

Felisa hopes to increase her income and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 50 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. 

For the past 20 years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale and will help Yusuf to generate greater profits and pay for his medical expenses. Yusuf hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 54 years old and married. She has nine children.

Merlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Merlie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and raising pigs.

Merlie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace still runs a retail shop and the business is doing great.

She has applied for a second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, and assorted beverages for sale in her shop and improve on her storage capacity. 

This will give variety to her customers. The anticipated profits will be used to support her ambition to expand her shop and give more services to her clients. 

Her future dreams is to have a residential place, a successful business and a bright future.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying sugar, rice and beverages.

loans.name: Neri

texts.en:
Neri is 60 years old and married. She has eight children.

Neri works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa (woven palm mats) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Neri has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa business for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Neri aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 32 years old and married to Antony. They have two children.

She has been running her pharmacy for a period of about eight years with an income of about KES 10,100 a month.

This is her first loan in KADET Ltd., and she wants to use it to add stock of medicines for sale. She hopes to be a leading chemist in the area and to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma runs a fishing business with her husband. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has two children, age 18 and 20. 

Gemma’s husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish and collect shells. Gemma sells her husband's catch to their community. 

She plans to use her loan to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help bring in more fish for Gemma to sell. Gemma hopes for their fishing business to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora is 30 years old and lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. 

She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. She earns 6,000 PHP per month selling rice, soft drinks, toiletries and snack foods in her store. Isidora works hard to improve her business and support her family financially. 

She plans to use her loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice and soft drinks. This will help increase Isidora’s sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 54 años de edad,  sus hijos  ya son mayores de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus nietos en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula.
Don José Luis tiene desde hace 10 años un negocio de una pulpería. El ofrece productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, manteca, harina, arroz,  azúcar, maseca, carnes lácteos, huevos, refrescos y productos de abarrotería. Con la ayuda de su esposa a sabido llevar bastante bien la administración del negocio ya que ella le apoya siempre. Con las ganancias que ha generado las ha logrado reinvertir y surtir más.
Don José es cliente por tercera vez de odef, solicito un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para comprar productos como lácteos, embutidos,  y otra parte la invertirá en la compra de dos frízer para congelar las carnes. Y así poder ofrecer a los clientes productos frescos y de buena calidad.
Su meta es tener el negocio con los productos que generen mayor demanda y así lograr incrementar sus ventas para tener una solvencia económica para ayudar a sus nietos en la educación.
texts.en:
José Luis is 54 years old, and his children are now adults.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and grandchildren in an outlying area of San Pedro Sula.

José Luis has had his grocery store business for ten years.  He sells staples like beans, lard, flour, rice, sugar, instant corn flour, dairy products, eggs, soft drinks, and grocery store items.  With his wife’s help he has known how to run the business very well.  His wife always supports him.  With the income generated from the business he has managed to reinvest and stock the store more.

This is José’s third loan with ODEF.  He requested a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy items like dairy products and sausages.  He will invest the other part in purchasing two freezers to freeze the meat.  This way he will be able to offer his customers products that are fresh and of good quality.

His goal is to have products that generate more demand in his store.  This way he will manage to increase his sales.  He will do this in order to have financial solvency so that he can help with his grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: to buy items like dairy products and sausages. He will also buy two freezers to freeze the meat.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 57 years old and married. She has one child.

Winnie works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa (woven palm mats) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Winnie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa business for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Winnie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells second-hand ladies' and children's dresses. She has been selling second-hand dresses for four years now.   

Ekua is married. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. 

Ekua needs this loan to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has a 5-year-old child.  

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.
  
She hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy hair products, tissue paper and soap.

loans.use: To buy hair products, tissue paper and soap.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 46-year-old married woman with five children between 6 and 15 years old. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Lydia earns a living selling home-cooked meals to her community. She has been doing this for three years. Lydia has also a part-time job cleaning and maintaining her neighbor’s house. She does this three times a week. 

Lydia works hard to provide for her family's needs and send her children to school. She requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil. Lydia hopes for her small business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives together with her family at Edukrom near Cape Coast. Mary sells onions, which she has done for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of his family. Mary will use her loan to buy bags of onions to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of onion to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena operates a  grocery shop at Edukrom near Cape Coast. This she has done for two years The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc.  

She is married and has five children. Abena uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Abena  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru:
Райкан 44 года, замужем. Райкан с 1999 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Райкан,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 лошадь, 3 коровы с приплодом, и 30 голов мелкого рогатого скота, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Райкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Райкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Raikan is 44 years old and married. Since 1999, she has been raising livestock, having launched her business with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Raikan's hard work, her herd currently has 1 horse, 3 cows with offspring, and 30 goats and sheep. She earns around 15,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to continue developing her business, Raikan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
