Matilda sells charcoal at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for eight years now.  

Matilda is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed the children and pay their school fees. 

Matilda will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Matilda will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman with 6 children. She supports her family through her sari-sari store business. She sells items like sugar, coffee, toiletries, canned goods and rice. Her husband is a fisherman and she also helps him sell his catch at the market. Maria does her best to keep her family healthy and happy. She requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods. She hopes to increase her income and be able to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama produces kenkey for sale at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. She has been selling kenkey since 3 years. She is married. Ama uses her income to assists her husband in providing for their children. She needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Ama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Aloice

texts.en:
Aloice is married and has two children.  He sells milk to earn a living. He has employed three people in his business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.

He hopes to grow his business and employ more people.  He has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy milk.

loans.use: to buy 20 crates of milk.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel paid his previous loan well and in good time. He has applied for his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET. He intends to purchase plant seedlings, fertilizers and farm inputs.

This will facilitate his crop output, yields and land preparations. The anticipated profits will support operations after planting and harvesting. His future plans involve improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase plant seedlings, fertilizers and farm inputs.

loans.name: Fernando Jovany

texts.es:
FERNANDO JOVANY tiene 53 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos de 28, 25,23 años de edad viven en san miguel provincia de bolívar.

FERNANDO JOVANY se dedica a la siembra al cultivo de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y pagar al jornalero.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que necesita para que los cultivos esten en un buesn estado.

Las compras lo hará en San miguel. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal tiempo.

El sueño es poder tener mayor producción con un buen sistema de riego.

En el tiempo libre le gusta juugar con los amigos indor futbol.
texts.en:
Fernando Jovany is 53 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 28, 25, and 23. He lives in San Miguel, Bolivar Province. Fernando plants and raises corn. He is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides, and to pay laborers.

With the assistance provided by this loan he will be able to buy what he needs to assure that his crop will be in good condition. Fernando will make his purchases in San Miguel. The challenges he faces include plant diseases and bad weather. Fernando's dream is to boost production by means of a good irrigation system. 

In his free time he likes to play indoor football with his friends.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is the lady peeling cassava. She operates a 'chop bar' (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for some years now. The food she serves is fufu, banku and rice balls. She is married with 2 children. Abena uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase food stuff and other ingredient to prepare food for sale. With her profit, Abena plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Numon

texts.ru: Нумон молодой человек в возрасте 33 лет.Он женат и имеет троих детей.Они вместе со всей семьей живут в Дж.Расуловском районе.Он работает маляром.Так как его зароботная плата маленькая и не хватает на семейные рассходы Нумон дома занимается выращиванием скота.Он покупает скот на местном ренке и откормив продает по дороже.Его жена домохозяйка,она занимается хозяйством и детьми,но в свободное время она помогает своему мужу. На полученный кредит Нумон хочет увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Numon is a young man 33 years of age. He's married and lives with his wife and three children in the J. Rasulov region of Tajikistan. He works as a decorator, but his salary is so small that is doesn't cover his family's expenses. In order to supplement his income, he runs a business buying and selling cattle. He buys cattle at the local market, fattens it and then sells it for profit. His wife takes care of their household and children, but in her free time she helps Numon with the business.  
A loan would allow Numon to purchase some livestock and increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: purchase livestock.

loans.name: Gulmayram

texts.ru:
Гулмайрам 42 года, замужем. Гулмайрам с 1994 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулмайрам,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку жеребцов.  Доходы от кредита Гулмайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulmayram is forty-two years old and married. Since 1994, she's run an animal raising business, having started this business with a capital of 5,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to her hard work she now owns 3 cows with offspring, and generates 15,000 soms a month in revenue via the sale of milk and milk products. 

In order to expand her business, Gulmayram approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 50,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase some stallions. She plans to reinvest proceeds from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase stallions.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo is 55 years old and lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his family. He supports his family through his sari-sari store business. He needs additional capital to sustain his business and cover household expenses. This loan will help Maximo buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries. Maximo hopes for his daily income to increase and enable him to provide for his family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Манучехр занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает продукты питания, хозяйственные товары и детские игрушки. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для покупки полуфабрикатов и наборов посуды.
texts.en: Manuchehr lives in the Farkhor Region. He is 33 years old. He is married, with two children. Manuchehr is a vendor. He mainly sells groceries, household goods and children’s toys.  He has been in this business for 18 years. He is taking out a loan to buy ready-to-cook food items and dish sets.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-cook food items and dish sets.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 56 years old and is a married woman with 6 children aged between 18 and 31 years. Her husband is a fisherman.

Virgilia has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 12 years. She earns 5000 PHP per month selling items like canned goods, shampoo, soap, vinegar and soy sauce. Virgilia also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional items to sell and to repair their fishing boat. Virgilia hopes to have increased sales and business profitability. She also hopes to elevate her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell and repair fishing boat

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of them are currently in school. For the past 13 years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essentials like soda and beer for resale and will help her to generate greater profit and pay for some basic needs like food for her family. Dorothy hopes that in the future she will be able to increase profits. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorothy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essentials like soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina used her previous loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for her tailoring business.  With the additional fabric, she was able to make more clothes which she sold and made more profits.  She also managed to add a stock of tomatoes in her green grocery shop.  She has requested another loan of 12,900 Kenya shillings to buy onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Betty Alexandra

texts.es:
BETTY ALEXANDRA tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija de dos años y con los padres en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

 BETTY ALEXANDRA es empleada privada. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un refrigerador, microhondas, batidora.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta, Las compras lo hara en San Miguel.

Los desafíos al que se presenta es terminar los estudios.

En el tiempo librte le gusta dormir y escuchar música, el sueño qu tiene es seguir una maestria y darle la eduacaión a la hija.
texts.en:
BETTY ALEXANDRA is 29 years old and is the single mother of a two years old girl.  She lives with her daughter and her parents in San Miguel, within the Bolivar province.

BETTY ALEXANDRA is a private employee and is asking for a loan in order to buy a refrigerator, microwave oven, and a mixer.
 
The loan will help her buy what she needs and she will make her purchases in San Miguel. 

Her challenges are completing her education. 

In her spare time she likes to sleep and listen to music.  Her dream is to earn a master’s degree and provide an education to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, micowave oven, and a mixer.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 36 years old and married to Alphaxad. Together they have two children, aged five and one year old. They live in Kitengela, from where she runs her milk business. She has been doing this business for one year now and plans to expand it.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 10,000 to increase the number of litres she buys for sale.This loan will enable her to grow her business as well as educate her children.

She hopes to become the best milk vendor in Kitengela.

loans.use: to buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Her main livelihood is a sari-sari (variety) store business, which enables her to support her family. She earns 2000 PHP per month selling snack foods, milk, coffee and canned goods to her community. Genoveva would like to generate more income and expand her business. She requested a loan to buy additional items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. Genoveva hopes to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single mother of three.  She runs a green grocery business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy french beans and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy french beans and tomatoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-nine years old, married to Korinko, and together they have three children. She runs a retail shop, and she has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This will be her first-time loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it for purchasing stock of sugar, rice,and some utensils for sale. 

She plans to use the profit to purchase more stock and expand the business. Her hope is to own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of sugar and rice, and some utensils.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past 5 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his studio shop which does photography. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machines to be used for photography, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and pay for his family's medical expenses. Peter hopes that in the future he will continue to earn more profits. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more machines to be used for photography

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
44-year-old Simeona lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol with her family. She is a married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 12 and 14. Her husband works as a provincial jail guard.

Simeona supports her family through raising pigs. She started this business 2 years ago. She requested a loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. She hopes for her income to increase and be able to help sustain her children's education. In the future, Simeona hopes to expand her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Percy Alain

texts.es:
Percy tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas playas hermosas, por sus riquísimos camarones así como también por su agricultura en especial  el cultivo de arroz. Cuando Percy tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar en una universidad.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo optimismo Percy trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en su vivienda; el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 11 horas al dia ya que se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad.

Percy está muy feliz y agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como azúcar, fideos, conservas, menestras, entre otros; así como también comprar un tanque de agua para su vivienda ya que el abastecimiento de agua en su barrio es por horas y tener un tanque lo ayudaría mucho para no padecer de este servicio; así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida, de esta manera seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Percy is 36 years old and lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for having beautiful beaches and delicious shrimp. Camaná is also known for its agriculture, especially its rice crops. When Percy has free time, he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends from the area. He also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the flavorful "chupe de camarones" (Peruvian shrimp chowder). Since his parents had limited financial resources, he was only able to complete his high school education. He would have liked to have studied at a university.

With great effort and optimism, Percy works at his business selling groceries from his home. He works at his business approximately 11 hours a day and must wake up very early to open his store. Percy believes he is doing well in his business because he is very friendly with the customers and offers quality products.

Percy is very happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy merchandise for his business such as sugar, noodles, preserves, dried vegetables, and other products. He will also buy a water tank for his home because the water service in his neighborhood charges by the hour. Having a water tank will be a great help because he will not have to pay for this service, which will help him to improve his income and have a better quality of life. Percy continues to strive toward his greatest dream of having a larger business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store and a water tank for his home.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like salt for resale, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like salt for resale

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.ru: Акрамчон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Акрамчон разводит скот у себя дома. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Akramjon lives in the city of Khujand. He is 34, married, and has three children. Akramjon has been raising cattle at home for over 12 years. He is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is married and has two children. She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been running the business for one year. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.

Lydiah hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of potatoes.

loans.use: To add stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 57 years old and a mother of two children who are already grown up. She lives and operates her business in Kitengela town. Joyce has been selling shoes for three years now and she finds it profitable. She has already established her customer base and that's why she needs this loan so as to add more stock of shoes for sale.

She desires to open another stall for selling shoes. This will help her increase her income and she will be able to support even her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has four children.  She runs a grocery business to earn a living.  She has been in the business since 1993.  She also owns rental houses which earns her more income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. 
 
She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru:
Гулнаре 47 лет, замужем. Гулнара с 1997 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова с приплодом, 3 лошади, 2 бычка, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят.  Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 47 years old and married. She has been raising livestock since 1997, having started her business with an initial investment of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, her herd currently has 1 cow with offspring, 3 horses and 2 calves, with sales of milk and dairy products bringing around 15,000 som per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulnara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is twenty-nine years old. Married to Margaret with two children, he supports four members of the family, and he has been running a farming business for six years, earning monthly income of twelve thousand five hundred shillings. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. 

He intends to use the profit from the business to buy a plot of land and build a permanent house. His dreams and hopes are to expand the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and others.

loans.name: Kasaine

texts.en:
Kasaine is married with three children and supports four members of the family. He has been running a horticultural farming business for seven years, earning a monthly income of eight thousand shillings. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use it for purchasing farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds, and also intends to use the profit to improve his farming business and be a horticultural dealer in future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and others

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married and has two children.  She runs a green grocery business to earn a living.  She has been engaged in the business for three years.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, onions, avocados and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions, avocados and tomatoes.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es una mujer ama de casa, vive con su esposo y una hija junto a su pareja realizan actividades agrícolas sembrando maíz y frijoles para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como el abono, la semilla mejorada y los herbicidas y también el alquiler del terreno pues se disponen a realizar la siembra de esta temporada. Este préstamo les ayudara a proporcionarles todo lo necesario.
El objetivo de Esmeralda es apoyar a su esposo para realizar juntos el trabajo que le asegura la alimentación para su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a housewife.  She lives with her husband and daughter.  She works together with her husband growing corn and beans to support the family.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials like fertilizer, improved seeds, and herbicides.  She will also use the loan to rent the land to get ready for this season’s planting.  This loan will help them get all of the supplies they need.

Esmeralda’s objective is to support her husband in order to do the work together that will assure her family of food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, improved seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru:
Рахат 25 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Рахат с 2004 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со скота, подаренного в качестве подарка на свадьбу. Благодаря упорному труду Рахат,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  5 коров с приплодом, 10 овец, а  также Рахат возделывает 2,50 га земли, где выращивает  клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Rakhat is 25 years old, married, and is raising 2 children. She has been engaged in animal husbandry since 2004, having started her business with cattle she received as a wedding present. Thanks to Rakhat's hard work, her herd currently has 5 cows with offspring and 10 sheep, and she also cultivates 2.5 hectares of land where she grows clover. Her monthly profits total approximately 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Rakhat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: James

texts.en: James serviced his previous loan well and in good time, and the business is doing great. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use it for purchasing foodstuffs such as sugar, flour, tomatoes, onions, green grams, and others. He also plans to use the profit for increasing business stock and to open another branch in future.

loans.use: to  buy foodstuffs such as sugar, flour, tomatoes, onions, and green grams

loans.name: Jochebed

texts.en:
Jochebed is 39 years old, and a mother of two children, aged twelve and eleven years old. She has a butcher shop in Kitengela where she has worked for three years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 4,000. 


She wants to increase her stock so that she can meet her customers' demand and in return get better income for her family. 


She dreams of buying land and constructing houses for rental so as to boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for sale.

loans.name: Roni

texts.en:
Roni is a 30-year-old man and is married to Risna, a 27-year-old lady. They have two children namely Risni, 6 years old, and Marsella, 2 years old. Roni runs a broiler business. The business is located separately from his residence. In a month, Roni usually buys up to 300 chicks and feed from the supplier; he raises the chicks for 21 days then sells them to customers in the market. 

Roni intends to buy 600 more chicks to be raised. For that reason, Roni applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000.

loans.use: to buy 600 more chicks to be raised

loans.name: Karim's Group

texts.en:
Karim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s thread roll sales business. With the loan investment, he will buy thread rolls in bulk quantity that will allow him to fill larger orders on time and increase his income.  

Karim herself is an embroidery and sewing expert who works for her neighboring clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are illiterate and support their father in his business. 

Karim and her family are very hard working by nature and work 8-10 hours a day. She is confident about her husband’s business success as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy thread rolls for resale

loans.name: Terfina

texts.en:
Terfina is a 53-year-old widow who is living with her two children, Febby, 31; and Denny, 28. Both of the children graduated from University. As a single parent, Terfina has a big responsibility to take care of her children and to fulfill the household needs. This situation led her to initiate a rental house business. She has been operating the business for 6 years. She has four rooms to rent. 

Terfina dreams of enlarging the business by building three more rooms. Therefore she requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000 that would be spent on building materials, i.e., sand, cement, zinc, bricks, nails, etc.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, i.e., sand, cement, zinc, bricks, nails, etc...

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is twenty-five years old, married to Charles who is a businessman, and they have one child who is three years old. She runs a beauty salon and she has been in this business for six years, earning a monthly income of seven thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of hair chemical, braids, and facial chemicals. She intends to use the anticipated profit to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more hair chemicals, braids, and facial chemicals to stock

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos tiene 29 años vive con su conviviente la señora Lilian tienen 3 hijos pequeños que dependen de sus ingresos, el señor Juan Carlos trabaja en una empresa de limpieza recogiendo basura, el sueldo que percibe apenas les alcanza para cubrir los gastos de la casa, actualmente viven  en la en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la  casa de su hermano en una solo habitación  y  donde las 5 personas están sufriendo demasiado por la incomodidad en la que viven, por lo tanto el destino del crédito es para la construcción de obra fina de su pequeña  casa , con sus ahorros ha logrado comprar un lote de terreno en un lugar alejado de la ciudad donde poco a poco ha logrado construir la obra bruta.
Entre sus metas principalmente esta termina de construir su casa para que de esta manera puedan vivir en su casa propia y más cómoda, y seguir trabajando duro para darles un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 29, lives with his life partner, Lilian.  They have three little ones who are dependent upon their income.  Juan Carlos works gathering trash for a cleaning company.  His salary is barely enough to cover the household expenses.  

They currently live in the city of Cochabamba.  They live in his brother’s house.  They live in only one room, where five people are suffering a great deal due to how uncomfortably they are living.

Therefore, the loan is for the finishing construction work on his small house.  With his savings he has managed to buy a plot of land in a place away from the city.  Little by little he has managed to complete the initial work.

One of his main goals is to finish building this house so that they can live more comfortably and in their own house.  Another of his goals is to continue working hard in order to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for the finishing construction work on his small house.

loans.name: Rancho Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Maria Cristina cuenta con 22 años de edad  está casada con el señor Juan Carlos que se dedica al Campo, tienen 2 hijos Juan Manuel que apenas tiene 1 año y medio y el otro bebé de apenas 2 meses de nacido.

Maria Cristina tiene un negocio ahí en su casa lo cual vende antojitos Mexicanos como son los tacos dorados, de cecina, chalupitas, tostaditas, quesadillas y atole lo cual de eso mantiene a su apenas pequeña familia, y piensa invertir su préstamo en los ingredientes que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como es: Pollo, Cecina, jitomates, cebollas, y también ocupa los platos para que sus clientes se puedan llevar.
Maria Cristina es una de los 10 integrantes del grupo Rancho Nuevo dicho nombre fue por el poblado donde habitan cada uno de ellos, a continuación serán mencionados sus integrantes y las actividades ala que se dedican ellos son: Geydili vende dulces, Catalina vende carne de puerco, Jesus vende comida, Rosi vende perfumes, Jair vende maíz, Maria Cristina vende antojitos, Yazmin vende zapatos, Joel vende garrafones de agua, Adilenne vende perfumes y Ana Karen vende tacos y enchiladas.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 22 years old and married to Sr. Juan Carlos, who is a field laborer. They have two children, Juan Manuel who is only 1½ years old, and another baby who is 2 months old.

Maria Cristina has a business in her home where she sells Mexican street food such as golden tacos, pork tacos, mini-chalupas, mini-tostadas, quesadillas, and "atole" (a hot beverage made with cornmeal). This enables her to provide for her small family. Maria Cristina plans to invest her loan in the ingredients that she uses for preparing Mexican street food such as chicken, pork, tomatoes, and to buy plates so that her customers can carry the food.

Maria Cristina is one of 10 members of the group "Rancho Nuevo", which is named after the village where they live. The following list shows the members and their business activities: • Geydili sells sweets. • Catalina sells pork. • Jesús sells food. • Rosi sells perfumes. • Jair sells corn. • Maria Cristina sells Mexican street food. • Yazmin sells shoes. • Joel sells jugs of water. • Adilenne sells perfumes. • Ana Karen sells tacos and enchiladas.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing Mexican street food.

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de medicamentos para surtir el negocio, ella quiere seguir incrementando sus productos a través de la compra de vitaminas, productos medicinales, analgésicos, antihistamínicos, que le ayuden a mantener a su clientela satisfecha.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le permitió tener mayores ventas y que sus condiciones económicas en la familia fueran mejor, teniendo más solvencia frente a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is seeking a new loan so that she can purchase supplies and stock up her business.  She wants to continue growing her product line with the purchase of vitamins, medical supplies, painkillers, and antihistamines, all things that will help keep her customers happy.

She had a positive experience with her previous loan and it enabled her to improve her sales.  The economic condition of her family improved and she was able to put more credit against her debt.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, medical supplies, painkillers, and antihistamines.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rada's Group

texts.en: Rada is 31 years old, single and lives in a rural village in the Mongkol Borey district of Cambodia. For the last several years, he has earned a living as a rice farmer and a taxi driver. He earns about KHR 8,500 per day from his work. Rada is requesting his first loan from VisionFund while the other member of this two-person loan group has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. They are applying for loans of 1,000,000 KHR and KHR 1,400,00 respectively.  As the group leader, Rada is going to use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. His goal is to earn more income to meet his his future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Horm's Group

texts.en:
A 54-year old widow, Horm is a rural villager living in the Mongkol Borey district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She has struggled throughout her life to make a living as a rice farmer on one-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for almost 26 years. The main challenge for her is the small farmland and low crop yields.

Horm’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for 2 cycles. Horm has successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her business so as to afford to purchase a hand tractor and extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Houn is 42 years old and lives in a rural village in the Mongkol Borey district of Cambodia. He has two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom live at home and attend school. Houn has worked as a rice farmer for the last 23 years and supplements his income with other work while his wife sells groceries in front of their house and raises pigs on the side. He is able to earn an income of approximately KHR 9,000 per day from his farm, and his main challenge is flooding, which prevents him from growing rice. 

Houn is requesting his second loan from VisionFund as is the other member of his loan group. They are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he is going to use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland and to buy groceries for his wife to sell. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rosa Lili

texts.es:
Rosa, quiere seguir trabajando en la venta de pan por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le ayude a realizar la compra de pan de diferentes clases, pues esto le ayudara a mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes y los ingresos al hogar.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mantener en el negocio un surtido de pan, con lo que mejoro su estado económico y una mayor solvencia frente a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to continue working in her business selling bread.  This is why she is requesting a new loan, which will help her to be able to buy all types of bread.  This will help her to maintain her customer's loyalty and the income of her household.  

With her previous loan, she managed to keep her bread business well stocked, and so she was able to improve her financial situation and have better solvency with regard to her financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy all types of bread to re-sell

loans.name: Muafia's Group

texts.en: Muafia is married and the mother of four children, one of whom attends school while the others stay at home. Her husband is a daily wage laborer who works very hard to earn an income for his family. Muafia is a very efficient person and performs her household duties very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand the sewing business she started few years ago to help her husband support their family. She is very good at this line of work, and receives regular orders every month. With this loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete orders on time and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Hanner Rafael

texts.es: Hanner de 24 años de edad, es un buen emprendedor que desde hace tres años tiene su propia microempresa; allí  vende productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, actividad auspiciada por su madre, cuando le dio la primera mercancía como perfumes, colonias y ropa, para que la vendiera entre sus compañeros de estudio  y vecinos. Así fue como gradualmente hizo su propia clientela y cuando estuvo posicionado en la mente de sus clientes, se vinculó a la venta de productos mediante catálogos. Hoy sus sueños emprendedores lo incitan a continuar su crecimiento, por eso su meta es continuar mejorando sus ingresos, para ingresar a la universidad y finalmente ser muy exitoso. Su crecimiento en el mercado de clientes, es cada vez mayor, por eso su capital de trabajo aunque reúna dinero, producto de su cobranza a sus clientes, le resulta insuficiente para atender su demanda. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza y de cuidado personal, que vinieron promocionados en su revista, con descuentos especiales y quiere impactar a su clientela con esta buena oferta, para continuar fidelizándola. Esta es justamente la razón de su éxito en la inversión de su credikiva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hanner is 24 years old, he is a good entrepreneur, and for three years he has owned his own business.  He sells products via catalogues.  He began doing this because of his mother.  She gave him his first merchandise such as perfumes, colognes, and clothing so that he could sell them to fellow students and neighbors.  This is how he gradually began forming his own clientele and when he was positioned to do so, he began selling via product catalogues.

Today his dreams continue to grow and his goals are to continue increasing his income (so that he can go to the university) and to be very successful.

His market is growing and so is the amount of capital that he needs to continue providing the products his customers demand.  This is precisely why people go to CreiKiva, and this will be his first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy beauty and personal products that he will promote in his catalogue with special discounts.  He wants to offer great prices to his customers so that he can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why will be successful in investing his CrediKiva loan in his business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and personal care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the engine in his taxi.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has two children. She runs a salon to earn a living, and she has been in this business for one year. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Josephine has been able to grow her business by training in management skills. She hopes to further improve her business in the future.  

Josephine has requested 30,000 KES to buy a hair dryer and braids.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and braids.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en: Ghazi is 23 years old and lives in the old city of Nablus. He is single but responsible for five people, his three sisters and his parents. In 2010, he went into business by opening his own bakery. He has five years experience in this field. Ghazi has applied for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and do some maintenance work on his bakery. His goals for the future are to improve his standard of living, educate himself and his sisters and open a shop in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and do some maintenance work on his bakery

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married and has three children. She sells sawdust to earn a living, and she has been in this business for seven years. She also sells firewood to supplement her income.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Naomi has been able to grow her business by learning business management skills. She hopes to further improve her business in the future. 

Naomi has requested 30,000 KES to buy sawdust for sale.

loans.use: to buy sawdust for sale.

loans.name: Mohamad Ramzi

texts.en: Mohamad is a 65-year-old married man who has run a convenience store since 1969. With 43 years of experience in this field, he has developed a wide customer base in his neighborhood. Currently, he earns a living by selling a variety of products, including groceries and sweets. He is applying for a loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua to begin selling mobile phone recharging cards. This product is in high demanded in his area and selling these cards will allow him to increase his income.

loans.use: to begin selling mobile phone recharging cards.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 50-year-old married man and father of three children. He has developed great knowledge in fruits and vegetables with his 17 years of experience in this trade. Imad’s customer trust and reliance are the sources of his excellent reputation in the region.

In an effort to maintain his superior client service, Imad needs to ensure the constant availability of produce. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his current supply and enhance his capacity for future purchases.

Imad hopes that he will develop his business from a mobile retail to a grocery store on the highway, which would provide him with more visibility to passing customers and decrease his transportation costs.

loans.use: to increase his current supply and enhance his capacity for future purchases.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has two children. She runs a salon to earn a living, and she has been in this business for over three years.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Agnes has been able to grow her business by training in management skills. She hopes to further improve her business in the future.  

Agnes has requested 20,000 KES to buy a hair dryer and braids.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and braids.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 38 years old and supports four family members. For four years, she has been running a general store, earning a monthly salary of 14,250 KES.

This will be Purity's first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase items such as sugar, salt, match boxes, and soft drinks for sale. 

She intends to reinvest the profits in her shop, and her future hopes and dreams include expanding and stabilizing her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed, 45, is from Gaza; she is married with four children--a girl and three boys. Taghreed has been working as a tailor for 22 years. Since January 2010, she has been operating her own sewing business out of her home.

Taghreed asked Ryada for funds to buy a new sewing machine and a generator. These will improve her work and help her secure a better future for her children.

Taghreed's ambition is to develop her sewing business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 49 years old and single with four children. She runs a green grocery, and she has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of 14,200 KES. 

This will be Millicent's first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more produce, such as onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables. She intends to use the profits to expand her business into larger markets.

loans.use: to purchase produce for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married man and father of three children. After working for eight years in auto detailing, he opened up his own business, providing car body painting, polishing, waxing, and metalworking. On his own for 12 years now, Ali has gained many customers who trust and respect him for his precision and his punctuality.

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua, which he will use to purchase used car parts such as front covers and doors. Ali intends to restore the parts and make them as good as new, offering his customers a cheaper option than new parts.

loans.use: to purchase used parts for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single young man, managing his father’s shop for the past four years. Currently, he sells dairy products like yogurts and cheeses, as well as sweets, beverages, cigarettes, and various food products.

Ali is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to increase his shop’s current inventory. Owning the only convenience store in his neighborhood, Ali indeed has an advantage; however, he has to accommodate the demand from everyone in the neighborhood. Therefore, the money will help Ali maintain the availability of his products and better serve his customers.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s current inventory

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en: Evalyn is 53 years old and married to Nelson, who is also in business. She has constructed rental houses, which has been her source of income for the last 15 years. Evalyn plans to buy paints and fittings so that she can renovate her houses. With this loan she hopes to improve the houses and add more in the future so that she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and supports two members of his family. He is married to Serah, and they have five children. He runs a retail shop. He has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of 9,700 KES.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase more sugar, soap, salt and other items. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to buy a plot of land and hopefully expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, soap, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is married and has two children. He sells clothes to earn a living, and he has employed two other people.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Paul has been able to grow his business by training in management skills. He hopes to further improve his business in the future and to employ more people.  

Paul has requested 80,000 KES to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de fotocopiadora y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia el negocio de fotocopiadora lo realiza desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y los productos de belleza los vende en forma independiente,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,perfumes y cremas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth continues to work in her photocopy business and she is also selling beauty products.  She works in the photocopy store from 7:00 AM until 7:00 PM and she sells her beauty products independently.  This work enables her to raise her children.  Her dream is to grow her photocopy business and her beauty product business.  She is asking for a loan so that she can buy beauty products such as lip liners, perfumes, and lotions.

She is happy for the loan and she promises to make punctual payments.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as lip liners, perfumes, and lotions.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa forma parte del Banco comunal “Aguas Subterráneas” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida, específicamente sopaipillas, empanadas, entre otros productos. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja sola y  que ofrece sus productos a sus clientes en un carro que ubica al frente de un supermercado. Ahí atiende de lunes a viernes desde las 8ºº hasta las 17ºº horas. ya que el fin de semana se dedica a las labores domesticas.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en diferentes distribuidoras y supermercados, directamente en la ciudad de Valparaíso a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ingredientes para su negocio. especificamente harina, aceite y zapallo (verdura de color naranjo, la cual le brinda color y sabor caracteristico a la sopaipillas).
Una de sus metas es instalar un local establecido en su propia casa, ya que de esta manera trabajaria de una forma mas cómoda, evitando el frio durante la temporada de invierno y el calor durante la temporada de verano.
Luisa vive junto a su marido, su hijo, y un sobrino quienes estudian. Uno de sus sueños son prósperar en su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, ya que éste es muy unido y solidario.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en: Luisa is part of a Communal Bank called “Aguas Subterráneas”  in the city of Viña del Mar. She prepares food, specifically sopapillas (a dessert that can be made with sugar, whipped cream, chocolate or fruit over a fried tortilla), empanadas (similar to a pasty) and other items. She has held this job for two years. She works alone and sells her foods from a car and is open from Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm. She says that she buys her supplies directly from Valparaíso at a low price, which suits her budget. With the credit she will purchase more materials for her business. One of her goals is to install a storefront in her own home. Luisa lives with her husband, her son and a nephew who both study. She is very grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza as the credit will help her reinvest in her business. Also, she feels comfortable in the Communal Bank group of which that she is a part. Viña del Mar is a city and community located on the central coast of Chile, known as the Garden City because of all the gardens and patios that some of the older homes in the city have. It is also considered the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, and gourds

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Con la confianza de poder alcanzar sus ideales y que con  el acompañamiento de la Fundación Paraguaya  podrían lograrlo, en la Ciudad de Caaguazú, se formó un comité con 12  señoras humildes con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, todas ellas tienen un gran espíritu de superación.
Sonia es la presidenta del grupo, y ella nos cuenta que siempre pone de su mayor espfuerzo para poder motivar a sus amigas y que de esa forma puedan seguir trabajando. Sonia se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como ser empanadas, croquetas, tortillas, sándwiches y otros. Es gracias a este negocio que puede ayudar a su familia y darles para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir vendiendo sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Having the trust and support of Fundación Paraguaya behind them to achieve their ideals, a committee of 12 humble ladies from the city of Caaguazú was formed. They all possess the drive to work and move forward, as well as the desire to succeed.

Sonia is the group president. She says that she always puts forth her best effort to motivate her friends so that they can continue working. Sonia sells food such as empanadas, croquettes, tortillas, sandwiches, and other items. Thanks to this business, she is able to help her family and provide for their daily needs. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and other necessary supplies so that she can continue selling her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación, se unieron de esa unión surge el grupo llamado Mujeres valientes, quienes tienen muy buena experiencia trabajando juntas y apoyándose las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes, es la Sra. Rosa, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante. Ella nos comenta que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia. Rosa comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, y es gracias a ese trabajo que ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, ya que tiene muchos pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Seventeen women from the city of Encarnación joined together and from that coming together the group called “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) arose.  They have very good experience working together and helping each other out.

One of the members is Rosa who is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead.  She comments that she always strives to the maximum to be able to help her family.  Rosa comments that she sells all types of clothes and thanks to this work she’s been able to get ahead and help her family.

She’s asking for the loan to buy winter clothes so that she can stock up and be able to meet customer demand since she has many pending orders that she’d like to be able to fill.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Mujeres para el desarrollo se destaca por ser un grupo muy constante en la lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Todas ellas cuentan con sus emprendimientos propios, pero también trabajan juntas y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Dionicia es una de las miembros, ella tiene una pequeña despensa, en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora y comenta que sueña con poder seguir agrandando su negocio y de esa forma cada día ser mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, embutidos, carnes, y demás productos, ya que son los que más vende y quiere tener bien surtido su negocio. Dionicia agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo ella y su grupo.
texts.en:
The women of the committee "Mujeres para el Desarrollo" are constantly fighting for the well-being of their families.  They all have their own enterprises, but they also work together and help one another.

Dionicia is one of the members.  She has a small dispensary, in which she works starting very early in the morning.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who says that her dream is to keep growing her business and make it better and better each day. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase drinks, baked goods, sausages, meats and other products, since these are her best-selling items.  She wants her business to be well-stocked.  Dionicia thanks the Paraguay Foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that they have given to her and her group.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, baked goods, sausages, meats and other products.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité “El Progreso” es de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día luchan por sus hijos ya sus familias.
Victoria es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, fundas y demás tipos. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y con un gran espíritu de superación, ya que por ello no se cansa de trabajar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás insumos para poder vender. Agradece por la ayuda que ellas y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The El Progreso communal bank is in the city of Santaní and consists of 11 very hard-working women with desires to move forward. These women are the heads of their households and fight every day for their children and families.

Victoria is one of the group's members. She makes a living through abundant sales of all types of products such as sheets, blankets, covers and other items. She is an enterprising woman with a resilient spirit, and this is why she never gets tired of working.

She is requesting this loan to buy sheets, blankets, comforters and other items that she can sell. She is thankful for the help that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use:
Comprar sabanas, frazadas, edredones, etc.
to buy sheets, blankets, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Integracion Group

texts.es:
El comité “Integración” se está en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Son 12 mujeres que se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a sus familias; anhelando un futuro distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir.
Lucia forma parte de este grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de guampas (utensilio que se utiliza para mate y terere) en lo que le va muy bien ya que es muy utilizada. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo ya que sabe que su trabajo es el sustento de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de guampas, las cuales ella revenderá y tendrá una mayor ganancia. Lucia agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The committee "Integration" is in its third cycle of the program known as Women Entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan Foundation.  They are twelve women who strive to raise their families, hoping for a future that is better than their past.

Lucia is part of this group.  She sells "guampas," a utensil made of a hollowed gourd for drinking mate. Business is going well since her product is widely used.  She is a hardworking entrepreneur who always tries her best, knowing that her job is to support her family.

Lucia is requesting a loan to buy guampas, which she will resell at a profit.  Lucia is thankful for the help she is receiving from Kiva and from the Paraguayan Foundation.

loans.use: to buy drinking gourds for resale.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Isidro de Caaguazú  es integrado por 13 señoras, tienen meses de trabajo  como grupo  ya que eran vecinas y muy unidas. Ellas vieron en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda, no solo para ellas sino también a la larga para sus familias, es por ello que se unieron.
Eulalia es una de las miembro del grupo, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de perfumes. Gracias a su calidez con las personas y sumado al buen precio de sus productos ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
Su meta es seguir creciendo y en vista a esto es que solicita el crédito, para la compra de perfumes de todo tipo, lo cual quiere vender y de paso cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Isidro de Caaguazú” committee is composed of 13 women who have been working as a group for months since they are very united neighbors.  They see in the Fundación a great help not only for themselves but in the long run for their families too which is why they joined together.

Eulalia is one of the group members.  She relates that she sells all types of perfume.  Thanks to her warmth towards people added to the good prices of her products she already has a good clientele that always buys products from her.

Her goal is to continue growing and this is why she’s asking for the loan to buy all types of perfume to sell and coincidentally to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry es de la ciudad de Luque, esta integrado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, son mujeres luuchadoras y por sobre todo muy sacrificadas que se esmeran día a día por poder ayudar a sus familias e hijos.
La sra. Genara se dedica a la venta de productos en general, es soltera, mama de dos hijos el mayor tiene 17 y la menor tiene 3 años. Ella solicita el credito  para la compra de ropas para dama caballeros y niños, sabanas, zapatos, etc, lo cual le ayudará a tener una mayor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
Genara  tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindar asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familiay que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group is made up of fifteen women from the town of Luque. They are hardworking people who make a great effort every day to help their families and children.

Sra. Genara sells a range of products. She is a single mother of two children; the elder is 17 and the younger 3. Genara is seeking a loan to buy men’s, women’s and children’s clothing, shoes etc. which will give her a greater variety of items to offer her customers. Her goal is to expand her business and thus provide a better standard of living to her family so they will lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy men’s, women’s and children’s clothing, shoes etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras-Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Luchadoras”, está integrado  por  20  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona, que son amigas y vecinas. Estas mujeres se destacan por trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Claudelina es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, y con este trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da los medios para tener una vida digna y decorosa. Su meta es seguir creciendo y el día de mañana ser una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de carne, panificados, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Su grupo y Claudelina agradecen por la ayuda que estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Mujeres Luchadoras”.  It has 20 members who are all very active and supportive ladies who live in the same area.  They are all friends and neighbors.  These women stand out because of their joint work and the fact that they help each other.

Claudelina is one of the members of this group.  Her business is selling all kinds of food.  Through this work, she helps her family and provides them with the means they need to live a decent life.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business and to become an important micro-businesswoman.

Claudelina is requesting the help of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy meat, baked goods, seasonings and other products that she needs so that she can continue making the food that she sells.  Claudelina and her group are thankful for the help that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, baked goods, seasonings and other products

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto tiene 44 años de edad,  es casado y tiene 4 hijos y estudian, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Morazán, Yoro.
Don Modesto tiene una fuente de ingreso que es un Finca de Café y adicionalmente también cultiva frijoles,  para el consumo y venta.  el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 1 año y medio donde logro obtener un terreno que el vendió un amigo. Esta motivado porque esta produciendo su propia cosecha y su esposa trabaja la tierra junto con el, el producto lo vende en el mercado local. Dice que el precio del café es muy rentable.
Don Modesto solicito a Odef un préstamo de 7,000.00 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para el mejoramiento y desarrollo de la finca de café. Con esta inversión lograra aumentar sus ingresos  sacando una mejor cosecha para la venta.
Su meta es trabajar muy fuerte para aumentar la producción de café y así permitirle tener una solvencia económica para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Modesto, 44, is married and has four children who are studying; he lives in a rural village in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro.

Modesto’s source of income is a coffee plantation and he also grows beans for his own consumption and to sell.  He’s been in this activity for a year and a half having obtained a parcel of land a friend sold him.  He’s motivated because he’s producing his own harvest and his wife works the land with him.  He sells his products in the local market.  He says that price of coffee is very profitable.

Modesto is asking ODEF for a 7,000 lempira loan to buy fertilizer and supplies to provide maintenance to improve his coffee development.  With this investment he will increase his income producing a better harvest to sell.  His goal is to work very hard to increase coffee production so that he can have good economic solvency for his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora    Karen quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, de esa union surge el grupo la Esperanza integrado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque.
La Sra.Karen se dedica a la venta  de bebida, ella esta casada con el señor Sebastian con quien tiene 1 hij, quien aun es muy pequeño. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que lo tiene bien surtido siempre y por eso tiene muchos clientes. Los días que mas venta tiene son los fines de semana y dias feriados, nos comenta que tiene como meta surtir el negocio para formar una despensa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, energizantes y demás tipo, con lo que podrá suurtirse y ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad a la que estan acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The contact person who started this existing committee is Sra. Karen. She invited and organized her friends to join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. This group emerged with the name "La Esperanza" (The Hope) and consists of 13 women from the city of Luque.

Sra. Karen sells beverages. She is married to Sr. Sebastian and they have one child who is still very young. Karen says that she is doing very well in her business because she is always well-stocked. As a result, she has many customers. She sells her products on the weekends and on fair days. Karen says that she hopes to acquire enough inventory for her business to open a store. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beverages such as sodas, wines, beer, energy drinks, and other products so that she can restock and offer her customers the variety to which they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to buy sodas, wines, beer, energy drinks, and other beverages.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 33-year-old married man and father of one child. Previously, he worked as a driver in a company. In 2006, he opened up his own narguile (hookah) business, offering a free delivery service. This model is quite popular in the country and especially in Atef’s region. With his excellent social relations, good geographical location and quality tobacco flavors, Atef has developed a good reputation in his neighborhood.

Working from his house, Atef needs to renovate the room he uses for narguile preparations; over the years, it got very tainted due to charcoal burning. He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will also invest part of the loan in doing necessary maintenance in his house, in addition to paying extra school fees. Additionally, he will use the rest of the money for his delivery car’s engine maintenance.

loans.use: to renovate the room he uses for narguile (hookah) preparations.

loans.name: Roberto Ramiro

texts.es:
ROBERTO RAMIRO tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 4 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

ROBERTO RAMIRO se dedica a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, habas y arveja. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, abono, líquido mata maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos que tanta falta le hace para los cultivos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la cosecha y el mal tiempo.

El sueño es poder dar la educación al hijo y que los cultivos sean buenos para tener buenas utilidades.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Roberto Ramiro, 43, is married and has a son; he lives with his wife and four-year-old son in San Miguel, Bolívar Province.

Roberto Ramiro works growing corn, lima beans, broad beans and peas.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies like urea, manure and weed killing liquid.

With help from the loan he will be able to buy the supplies he so needs for his crops.  The challenge he faces is harvest and bad weather.  

His dream is to be able to give his son an education and that his crops are good so that profits will be good.  In his free time he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Luchadoras es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Ines es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de leche, y nos dice que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que siempre se levanta muy temprano para poder distribuir el producto que vende a sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener más clientes y así mejorar más sus ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, ya que no quiere quedarse sin este producto, pues es lo que hace a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Luchadoras communal bank is in the city of San Lorenzo.  The members of the communal bank set the growth of each one of them as their main goal.  The members are known in their area as very hard-working women, and they help one another.

Ines is one of the members, and she sells milk.  She tells us that it is very demanding work.  She always gets up very early in order to be able to distribute the product that she sells to her customers.  Her goal is to be able to have more customers to improve her income.

She is requesting the loan to buy milk.  She does not want to be left without this product as it is what makes her work.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité Fortaleza se formó con la unión de 12 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Señora Cirila es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  las ventas de ropas, cosméticos y también de helados.
Es una señora muy creativa y con ganas de salir adelante y por sobre todo muy emprendedora. Ella  tiene 2 hijos y su marido es Policía. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y con el grupo que formaron.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo recibe.
texts.en:
Twelve female neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso formed the “Fortaleza” committee. These members formed a very unified group, capable of working together in order to help one another. 
Cirila is one of the members of the committee. She sells clothing, cosmetics and ice cream. She is a very creative woman with the will to get ahead, and above all, very enterprising. She is married with 2 children and her husband is a policeman. She is very satisfied with her business and the group they formed. She is requesting this loan to buy clothing, so she can stock up in order to offer her clients more variety. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for this opportunity that she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Johana Yamileth

texts.es:
Johana, se dedica a atender una sala de belleza, es madre soltera vive con su abuela, es una mujer responsable con su hogar, aprendió la cosmetología  como ayudante tiene mas de 6 meses de tener su propio negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como tintes, cremas, tratamientos para el cabello y otros productos que son utilizados en la sala de belleza. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el servicio a sus clientes manteniendo todo lo necesario para realizar un buen trabajo.
La aspiración de Johana es que a través del uso de prestamos pueda ampliar la sala de belleza y mejorar sus habilidades en la cosmetología  con el objetivo de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Johana has a beauty salon.  She is a single mother who is responsible with her home and lives with her grandmother.  She learned cosmetology as an assistant and has had her own business more more than six months.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy products such as dyes, creams, hair treatments, and others used in the beauty salon.  This loan will help her improve her customer service, maintaining everything she needs to do a good job.

Johana's goal is to be able to expand her beauty salon with the loans and improve her abilities in cosmetology, to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, and hair treatments.

loans.name: Yrysbubu

texts.ru:
Ырысбубу 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Ырысбубу с 1993 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 100 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Ырысбубу,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 коровы с приплодом, 7 овец, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль  с продажи молока  составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ырысбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Ырысбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Yrysbubu is forty-two years old, married and has three children. In 1993, with a starting capital of 100 soms, she began an animal raising business. Thanks to her hard work, that business has grown to 4 cows with offspring, 7 sheep, 1 horse, and a monthly revenue of 12,000 soms (KGS) via the sale of milk and milk products.  

In order to expand her business further, Yrysbubu approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 120,000 soms (KGS) intended to purchase sheep. Yrysbubu plans to reinvest profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Juana Lisepti

texts.es:
JUANA LISEPTI tiene 42 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Ventans provincia de los ríos.

JUANA LISEPTI tiene un local de billar. Solicita el crédito para pagar deudas y para comprar una mesa de billar.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá pagar las deudas y comprar la mesa de billar que será para incrementar el local.

Las compras lo harán en Quevedo. El sueño es poder contruir una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Juana Lisepti is 42 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives with her husband and child in Ventanas, which is located in Los Ríos Province.  

Juana Lisepti owns a billiard hall.  She is requesting a loan in order to pay off debts and to purchase a billiard table.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to pay off debts and purchase a billiard table in order to expand her establishment.  The purchase will be conducted in Quevedo.  Her dream is to build a house.  The challenges she faces include dealing with the competition.  

In her free time, Juana enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a billiard table and to pay off debts.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que tiene playas hermosas y un clima cálido, asimismo en el encontramos a las Islas Ballestas, las cuales reciben a infinidad de turistas en todo el año.
