A su lado vive su esposa quien es quien lo apoya en todo lo que el hacer y sobre todo es su mano derecha. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Victor trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, al igual que muchos pobladores de nuestro país el trabaja de sol a sol en esta clase de trabajo ya que no hay muchos empleos y es una forma de trabajar de manera honrada. El le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar llantas para su vehículo, así como también realizar un mantenimiento general, de esta manera podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado, lo que le permitirá transportar a sus pasajeros en un vehículo más seguro, así el podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y apoyar a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Victor is 34 years old and lives in Pisco, a town with beautiful beaches and a temperate climate. The Islas Ballestas are located here too; they are much visited by tourists throughout the year. Victor lives with his wife who helps him with everything that he does--she is his right hand. 

Victor puts a lot of effort into his job as a rickshaw driver. Like many people in our country, he works from sunrise to sunset as there aren’t many people doing this work. He says it’s a decent job. He works around ten hours a day and can have up to fifteen customers. His business is doing well as he’s a hardworking man and always looks after his customers well. 

Victor is very grateful to Kiva donors and thanks everyone for their help. He will buy tires for his vehicle with the loan and also have it serviced. This will ensure that his rickshaw is well-maintained so he will be able to transport his passengers safely. He is working to fulfill his biggest dream of providing a better standard of living for his family and support for his parents.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle and have it serviced

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La Sra. Candelaria tiene de 39 años de edad está casada  hace 8 años con el señor Reinaldo de 40 años, tienen 4 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes.
La señora Candelaria se dedica a la venta de masitas, y comenta que tiene este negocio desde hace 10 años, empezaron muy poquito y actualmente creció bastante el negocio, cuentan con más clientes y siempre ayudado por su esposo y los hijos.
Solicita este préstamos para la  compra de harina, miel, azúcar, condimentos y otros que serán utilizados en la producción de masitas, bollos, pasta frola, tortas y así poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene.-
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, Candelaria was able to substantially improve her business and has had more customers. That's why today she's asking for a new one, since she would like to continue growing. She wants to buy flour, sugar, honey, yeast, and other ingredients in order to continue making her goods. 

She appreciates the confidence extended to her.

loans.use: Comprar harina, miel, azúcar, condimentos y otros.

loans.name: Maria Edelina

texts.es:
MARIA EDELINA tiene 59 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en San Miguel provincia de bolívar.

MARIA EDELINA ella tiene un salon donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas. Solicita el crédito para comprar mesas, sillas, un horno grande. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar las compras que tanto necesita para poder agrandar el negocio.

Las compras de los realiza en San Miguel y ellas ventas de las comidas lo hace en San Miguel todos los días.

El suelo es poder ampliar el negocio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es llegar a tener un restaurante grande y que les guste mucho a los clientes.

En el tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 59, is married and has a 14-year-old son; she lives with her husband and son in San Miguel, Bolívar Province.

María Magdalena has an eatery where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She’s asking for the loan to buy tables, chairs and a large oven.  With help from the loan she will be able to make the purchases she needs to much in order to enlarge the business. She will make her purchases in San 
Miguel and she sells food every day in San Miguel.  

Her dream is to be able to enlarge the business and the challenge she faces is succeeding in having a large restaurant that will be very well liked by the customers.  She likes to knit in her free time.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a large oven.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer se encuentra, en su ciclo numero 18, ellas dicen que por medio de la unión que tienen han podido ir pasando los ciclos que tienen y cada vez son más unidas y les gusta más lo que hacen como grupo.
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Luz, ella tiene 49 años, tiene 4 hijos, de quienes tres ya son mayores e independientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de mercería, es decir que tiene todo tipo de artículos, como ser ropas, artículos para la casa, calzados y demás variedad de productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas y zapatos de variedad, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio, y de esa forma poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” (To Be Reborn) committee is in its 18th cycle.  They say that by means of the unity they have they’ve been able to pass through the cycles they’ve had and each time they are more unified and like what they do as a group more.

We can speak about Luz.  She’s 49-years-old and has four children; three of them are already independent adults.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising person who comments that she sells merchandise, that is, she has all types of merchandise like clothes, items for the home, shoes and other variety of products.

She’s asking for the loan to buy a variety of clothes and shoes to stock her business with and be able to offer a wider variety to her customers.  She’s grateful for the help they are getting.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio José Luis pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  

El socio José Luis tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de autopartes y accesorios como por ejemplo pistón, plato presor, empaques, bujías, retrovisor, direccionales, etc. El socio José Luis viaja  a lima una vez a la semana a comprar su mercadería. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio José Luis requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y desea comprar micas, adornos, fundas, forros, tapas, equipos de sonido para carro, parlantes y otras cosas más,  

El socio José Luis agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
José Luis belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Todos Unidos” (Everyone Together) communal bank in the city of Cusco.  

José Luis is 38 years old, married and has two children.  His main economic activity is selling auto spare parts and accessories like pistons, clutch covers, seals, sparkplugs, rear-view mirrors, turn signals, etc.  José Luis travels once a week to buy his merchandise.  He’s been in business fifteen years now and he does very well.  

On this occasion, José Luis needs the loan to buy merchandise.  He wants to buy light covers, decorations, seat covers, steering wheel covers, hub caps, auto sound systems, speakers and other things.

José Luis is grateful for the support he’s getting and commits to make his installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories.

loans.name: Enma Rita

texts.es: Enma es socia del Bancomunal Tulipanes, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas. Ella se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia,  se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, los vende en  las ferias y también en el mercado. Se siente muy bien en la institución porque aprendió a ahorrar, a ser solidaria, comprensiva, lo que más le gusta son las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, es ahí donde aprende a educar mejor a sus hijas y también a  desarrollarse como persona y como empresaria. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para así poder venderlas en las ferias y en el mercado .
texts.en:
Enma is a member of the Communal Bank "Tulipanes" (Tulips).  She is 48 years old and a single mother with two daughters.  Enma strives to move forward with her family.  She buys and sells grains.  Her products are sold at the fairs and also at the market.  She feels very good about FINCA because she has learned how to save, as well as how to be supportive and understanding.  What she enjoys most about the training classes offered by her Communal Bank is learning about how to do a better job of teaching her daughters and also how to develop as a person and as an entrepreneur.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy grains that she can sell at the fairs and at the market.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat, beans, and other grains.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia es socia del Bancomunal Amauta Huamanga, se dedica a la venta de chompas de lana. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, lo que más le gusta es el ahorro, y las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal por que le ayudan a ser mejor negociante y ser mejor madre, está muy feliz por todo lo que pudo lograr. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de chompas de lana para venderlas.
texts.en: Delia is a member of the Amauta Huamanga Communal Bank. She engages in selling woolen sweaters. She has been a member of FINCA Perù for 2 years, and what she likes the most are the savings and the seminars she received from her Communal Bank, as these help her being a better retailer and a better mother. She is very happy about everything she has been able to achieve. Then loan she is requesting will be used to buy woolen sweaters to resell.

loans.use: To buy woolen sweaters.

loans.name: Maria  Victoria

texts.es: María de 30 años, vive con sus padres y con su 1 hijo de 8 años  en San Jacinto, la tierra de hamacas y artesanías en tejido vertical, ubicada en el departamento de Bolívar. Ella justamente es una mujer artesana por tradición familiar, que fabrica con sus propias manos productos artesanales y los comercializa, en un mercado que poco a poco ha ido construyendo.  Esta actividad la  inició   desde hace 8 años, para generar ingresos y poder educar a su  hijo, su meta es ser una profesional y ampliar su negocio hasta generar ingresos sostenibles que beneficien a su familia. En la actualidad María está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará hilo en mayor volumen, pues ganará descuentos, por la compra de contado y en mayor cantidad y   fabricará bolsos y mochilas, que tiene encargadas y con ellas podrá ser mas competitiva y responder oportunamente a sus clientela y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de la inversión.
texts.en:
María, 30, lives with her parents and her 8-year-old son in San Jacinto, the land of hammocks and vertical loom crafts, located in Bolívar Department.  

She is precisely a craftswoman by family tradition who manufactures crafts with her own hands to sell in a market that she’s gradually built up.  This activity started 8 years ago to generate income and be able to educate her son.  Her goal is to be a professional and to expand her business until it generates sustainable income that benefits her family.

Currently, María is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy yarn in larger volume to qualify for discounts for cash and large volume purchases.  She will manufacture purses and backpacks that she has on order and with them she will be able to be more competitive and be able to respond to her customers in a timely fashion; this is precisely the reason for her investment’s success.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Delfre

texts.es: Delfre  de 34 años, vive en la bella e historica ciudad de Cartagena y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad. Él tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de juegos y vende refrescos y bebidas. Su negocio inició mucho antes de que se vinculara a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el año 2005; con esta organización   ha recibido 3 financiamientos, con los cuales ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, hacer adecuaciones y reparaciones a su mesa de billar  y a su enfriador. Delfre ofrece el servicio de juegos, vende gaseosas y cervezas, su negocio cada día ha logrado mayor reconocimiento y el paso siguiente ha sido su crecimiento. Los principales clientes son vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores aledaños, que pasan por allí a disfrutar de refrescos y bebidas frías y también juegan entre amigos.  Delfre maneja su negocio con estricto contado, tanto en sus compras como en sus ventas, cuenta con su infraestructura para el buen desempeño de su actividad y con un gran potencial de mejoramiento en aspectos locativos; tiene un empleado, que lo apoya permanentemente, especialmente los fines de semana, fecha en la cual se incrementan las ventas de sus productos y servicios.  En la actualidad está aplicando su primer credikiva, con el cual comprara cervezas, gaseosas, y realizará mejoramiento locativo, para volver su ambiente recreativo mucho mas confortable y potencializar el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en: Thirty-four-year-old Delfre lives in the beautiful and historic city of Cartagena and he has a six-year-old son.  He has a business where he offers games and sells sodas and other drinks.  He started his business long before he became affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in 2005; through this organization, he has received three loans with which he has been able to improve conditions in his business, and make changes and repairs to his pool table and to his cooler.  Delfre offers games, sells soft drinks and beer, and his business has become better known.  The next step is growing it.  His main customers are neighbors from his area and from other close-by areas who come by to enjoy sodas and cold drinks and also to play games with their friends.  Delfre manages his business with careful accounting, from his purchases to his sales.  He counts on his infrastructure to carry out his business activities well and he also counts on a huge potential to improve in terms of his location.  He has one employee who is always there to help him, especially on weekends, which is the time when his sales go up for both products and services.  He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan, and which he will use to buy beer and soft drinks and to improve his location to make his recreation area much more comfortable and to maximize his success with this loan.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks and to improve his business location

loans.name: Orlando  Rafael

texts.es: Orlando con su anterior credikiva, compró muchas frutas tropicales como la patilla y verduras frescas que vendió aumentando ligeramente su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, porque sus vendedores han pedido más productos, ya que  tienen una clientela fija y el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta Orlando no es suficiente, para el crecimiento de la demanda. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual su credikiva será éxitos, porque responderá a la demanda comprando  frutas y verduras de la cosecha, a un buen precio y sobre todo muy frescas.  Orlando dice a sus financiadores, que sus credikiva le han servido de mucho, Gracias y que lo sigan apoyando.
texts.en:
With his previous credikiva loan, Orlando bought a lot of tropical fruit such as watermelons as well as fresh vegetables, that he sold, increasing his working capital slightly. Now he is applying for a new credikiva loan, because his sellers have requested more products, as they have an established clientele, and Orlando's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why his credikiva loan will be successful, because he will respond to demand by buying fruits and vegetables from the harvest, at a good price and above all very fresh. Orlando tells the lenders that his credikiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you, and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as watermelons.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos” pertenecientes a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo articulos de juguetes, venta de ropa para niños y adultos, desde hace 6 años. Su puesto lo ubica en ferias libres los días domingo, y de lunes a sábado trabaja en su casa en la venta de articulos en general. Su mercadería es variada en ropa nueva y artículos de juguetes.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la ciudad de  Santiago ya que es un lugar en el cual encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo.
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva para niños y adultos, juguetes, regalos para aprovechar la temporada del dia del padre.
Una de las metas de Teresa es tener un bazar en su casa para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Teresa vive junto a su marido, 2 hijos de 28 y 29 años de edad, y 2 nietos.  Sus sueños a nivel familiar es poder ampliar su casa, asi optar a una mejor calidad de vida su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of “Todos Juntos” (All United), a Communal Bank belonging to the town of Viña del Mar.
She is a retailer, and activity she has been engaged in for 6 years. Her stall is located in the free markets on Sundays, while Mondays to Saturdays she works in her house. She sells a variety of general products, notably new clothes.
She generally buys he products in the town of Santiago, because it is there where she finds goods at low prices.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy various items.
One of Teresa’s goals is to open a bazaar in her house, in order to increase her earnings, reaching through this mean a better standard of living.
Teresa lives with her husband, their two children, aged 28 and 29, and two grandsons. The dream she has for her family is to be able to make her house bigger.
She is very happy about and grateful for the chance she has been given by Fondo Esperanza, as this has allowed her to invest in her activity.
She also feels really at ease in the company of the fellow members of her Communal Bank, because sharing with them different actives and interests is a good distraction she enjoys.
Viña del Mar is both a city and a township located on the central coast of Chile. It is known as “Ciudad Jardín” (Garden City) because of the gardens and patios found in some of the older homes in the city. Viña del Mar is also considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for children and adults, toys, and gifts to take advantage of Father's Day

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir mas en el negocio comprando elotes, plátanos, aceite, manteca, maiz, condimentos,  para seguir con su producción de alimentos. 
El préstamo anterior le ayudo crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar en la elaboracion de tamales, esto le ayudaro a mejorar sus ingresos, hoy en dia tambien ofrece platillos tipicos,sus condiciones en la familia ha sido mejor.
texts.en:
Idalia is asking for a new loan to be able to invest more in her business buying corn, bananas, oil, lard, corn and condiments to continue producing food.

The previous loan helped her to grow and to have everything necessary to work making tamales which helped to improve her income.  Today, she also offers typical dishes and her family condition has been better.

loans.use: to buy corn, bananas, oil, lard, corn and condiments.

loans.name: Albanas

texts.en:
Albanus is twenty years old and single with one child. He runs a retail business. He has been in this business for three years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan to add to his stock of sugar, milk, and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profit for educating his child. He wants to ensure they attain all of their basic needs in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sugar, milk, cooking oil, and other goods

loans.name: Medhat

texts.en:
Medhat is a 44-year-old married man and father of four children. After 12 years of experience in the retail business, he opened up his own store in 2001, selling electric parts and sanitary products. Since then, he succeeded in building a good reputation in the market due to the high quality and variety of his offerings.

Medhat is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his stock of products in the store. He is very satisfied with the assistance the microfinance loans provide him in developing and expanding his business. In raising his supply, Medhat will have the capacity to sell more and thus generate more income to support his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of products in the store.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar la disponibilidad de materiales para la elaboración de pan comprándose una cantidad considerable de harina, levadura, leña y otros productos, con los cuales estará trabajando en la mejora de su panadería.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a mantener las ventas con sus clientes y su condición en la familia a mejorado.
texts.en:
Ana is applying for a new loan to improve the availability of materials for making bread. She will buy a considerable quantity of flour, yeast, firewood and other products, with which she will be working to improve her bakery.

The previous loan had a positive effect, helping her to maintain sales to her customers, and her family's situation has improved.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, firewood and other products.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo con el objetivo de realizar junto a su familia una nueva siembra de maíz para esto deberá comprarse los insumos necesarios como el abono, los herbicidas que son aplicables para prevenir y fortalecer el cultivo.
El efecto que tubo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, su condición en la crianza de ganado a mejorado, durante este tiempo a permanecido ocupado en sus trabajos contando con ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan with the goal of starting a new corn crop with her family.  To do so, necessary supplies like manure and herbicides that are applied to the crops to prevent and strengthen the crops must be purchased.

The effect she had from the previous loan was positive.  Her condition raising cattle has improved.  During this time she’s stayed busy with her work earning income for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and has four children.  He sells clothes to earn a living.  He has been in this business for three years. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested a loan for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old and supports eight members of his family. He is married with three children. Their ages are thirteen, eleven, and six years. He runs a general store. He has been in this business for ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,500. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, and soap. He plans to use the profit from the business for an expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of sugar, rice, and soap

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Julio de 23 años de edad vive en San Jacinto y se dedica a la actividad comercial, desde que dejó de ser empleado de una empresa y su liquidación la invirtió en la compra de productos como  carnes frías y gaseosas, para venderlos  en un mercado doméstico, ubicado a su alrededor. Con esta actividad ha logrado obtener ingresos, para responder a sus gastos personales y poder estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas, de manera semi- presencial. Su meta más adelante es tener una bodega adecuada,  para convertirse en un distribuidor de productos fríos, comprando en grandes volúmenes y así mismo terminar su carrera profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, porque su mercado requiere más productos cárnicos y refrescos y con ello aumentaría sus ventas y poco a poco le permitirá ir escalando su crecimiento y principalmente el logro de sus metas.
texts.en:
Julio, 23, lives in San Jacinto and has been a merchant since he stopped being an employee in a firm; he used his severance pay to buy products like cold-cuts and soft-drinks to sell them in a domestic market located near him.  With this activity he’s earned income to cover personal expenses and to be able to study computer sciences part-time.  His goal for later on is to have an equipped warehouse to become a distributor of cold products buying in large volume and to finish his professional career.

Currently, he’s applying for a Kiva loan because his market requires more meat products and soft-drinks and with it he’ll increase sales and gradually escalate his growth and mainly reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy meat and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás de 56 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos en las edades de 28 a 32 años, es un hombre muy trabajador que desde sus 15 años,  no ha hecho mas que trabajar, para ayudar a sostener a su familia; primero vendió pescado, luego plátano, posteriormente trabajó en un hotel durante 15 años y hace 10 años una señora le enseñó a fabricar trapeadores y cuando elaboró el primero, lo estimuló a que emprendiera su propio negocio;  así fue que empezó fabricando sus primeros artículos y vendiéndolos él mismo, cargándolos al hombro, calle a calle, carrera a carrera. Posteriormente compró una carreta, para soportar el peso de los pedidos que conseguía y poco a poco ha ido complementando su negocio, con otros productos que compra en el mercado, como enseres de cocina y de aseo, a lo que finalmente le ha agregado ropa por demanda de su mercado. Su meta es continuar su crecimiento empresarial, mas adelante, conseguir un local comercial, vender al por mayor y también al detal, pero ante la necesidad de su mercado y el potencial de ventas, su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, para cumplir paso a paso sus propósitos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el que comprará en mayor volumen y de contado, ropa, lámparas, enseres, plásticos y de cocina, entre otros artículos. Su credikiva será exitoso, porque Nicolás conoce su mercado, se ampara en la demanda de este y comprará de contado y en volumen lo que le generará mayor competitividad en sus precios, por los descuentos que le otorgarán sus proveedores, en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 56, is married and has three children whose ages range from 28 to 32.  He’s a very hardworking man who since the age of 15 has done nothing more than work to help support his family.  First he sold fish, then bananas and later worked in a hotel for 15 years and ten years ago a woman taught him to make mops and when he made his first one this stimulated him to start his own business and this is how he started manufacturing his initial items and selling them himself carrying them on his shoulder from street to street, avenue to avenue.  

Later on he purchased a cart to support the weight of the orders he’d get and gradually he’s been complementing is business adding other products that he buys in the market like kitchen utensils and cleaning supplies.  Finally, he’s added clothes because of market demand.  His goal is to continue his business growth and later on to get a commercial space to sell at wholesale as well as retail.  

However, in face of market demand and sales potential his working capital is insufficient to reach his goals step by step which is the reason he’s calling on a Kiva loan to pay cash for larger amounts of clothes, lamps, kitchen utensils, plastic and kitchen items, among others.  His Kiva loan will be successful because Nicolás knows his market and he’s backed up by demand in it.  He will buy in volume and pay cash which will lead to more price competitiveness because of the discounts his suppliers will give him this season.

loans.use: to pay cash for merchandise.

loans.name: Piedra Ancha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Piedra Ancha esta conformado por ocho mujeres trabajadoras y humildes originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado Piedra Ancha. Una de las  tradiciones de este pueblo es la fiesta de la Virgen de los Remedios que se celebra el 25 de febrero y la fiesta de la virgen Natividad, todos las festividades se realizan por mayordomías.
La representante de este grupo es la señorita Edith de treinta años de edad, es una persona amable alegre y sobre todo muy trabajadora.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes en un local cerca de su casa donde vende lo que es aceite,café,azucar,leche,sabritas,galletas,papel higienico,jugos,refrescos y jugos.
Nos cuenta  que inicio su negocio comprando poca mercancía pero con sus ganancias fue comprando más y más hasta que logro tener su pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
Uno de sus sueños es engrandecer más su tienda de abarrotes y poner una papelería  ya que solamente  vende libretas, lápices y borradores y sus clientes le  piden que pongan una papelería ya que el pueblo es muy pequeño y no hay papelerías.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes y mercancía de papelería para la venta por menudeo.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado para que su negocio crezca cada día más y ayuda a sus paisanos.
Las otras integrantes de este grupo son
Celina- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Maria Luisa- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Pilar- se dedica a la venta de mercancía  de abarrotes.
Eufemia – se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Norberta- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Maria Josefa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por apoyar a las mujeres de pueblos maquinados  y sobre todo por preocuparse por los niños.
texts.en:
This group is called "Piedra Ancha" and consists of eight hardworking and humble women who are originally from a small town called Piedra Ancha. One of the traditions in this town is the Festival of the Virgin of Los Remedios, which is celebrated on February 25th, and the Festival of the Christmas Virgin. All of the festivals are sponsored by the local town councils.

The group representative is Srta. Edith, age 30. She is a friendly, cheerful, and hardworking person. She says that she sells groceries from a shop near her house. Edith sells oil, coffee, sugar, milk, snack foods, cookies, toilet paper, soft drinks, and juices. She says that she started her business by purchasing a little bit of merchandise. With her profits, she bought more and now has a small grocery store. One of her dreams it expand her grocery store even more and open a stationery shop that only sells notepads, pencils, and erasers. Her customers have asked that a stationery shop be set up in their small town since no such business exists. Edith is requesting a loan to buy more grocery merchandise and stationery products that she can sell at retail. She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support that has been given to her so that she can grow her business and help her fellow countrymen.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Celina sells chickens. • Maria Luisa sells chickens. • Pilar sells groceries. • Eufemia sells Mexican street food. • Margaritha sells groceries. • Norberta sells Mexican street food. • Maria Josefa sells Mexican street food.

They thank Fundación Realidad for supporting women from marginalized towns so that they don't have to worry about their children.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise and stationery.

loans.name: Victoriano Candelario

texts.es:
Victoriano, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la temporada de la siembra de maíz ya que necesita comprarse los materiales necesarios con el abono, los herbicidas y de semilla mejorada con esto espera iniciar su trabajo y que este sea productivo.
Con el préstamo anterior Victoriano considera que mejoro la fertilidad y los resultados de la cosecha y su familia cuenta con un nuevo miembro en la familia y sus condiciones económicas se han mantenido estables, espera seguir trabajando con prestamos de forma ordenada.
texts.en:
Victoriano is asking for a new loan for the corn planting season because he needs to buy the necessary supplies like manure, herbicide and improved seeds; he hopes to start his work with this and that it will be productive.

Victoriano believes that with the previous loan he increased fertility and crop results and his family now has a new member; his economic condition has remained stable and he hopes to continue working with loans in an orderly fashion.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mercy Jakeline

texts.es:
MERCY JAKELINE tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el conviviente y los hijos de 8 y 6 años y uno de 4 meses de edad.

MERCY JAKELINE  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arveja, además ella es carpintera. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, madera, pintura.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para la agricultura y la madera y la pintura para la carpinteria.

Los desafíosa a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero para poder invertir en la agricultura y la carpinteria.

El sueño es poder tener una casa propia y dar los estudios a los hijos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer, jugar con los hijos, disfrutar de las festividades de la virgen Santa Rita y fiestas del cantón.
texts.en:
Mercy Jakeline, 32, is in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her spouse and children who are 8 years and 6 years and 4 months old.

Mercy Jakeline grows corn, broad beans and peas; she’s also a carpenter.  She’s asking for the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, urea, wood and paint.

With help from the loan she will buy fertilizer for the agriculture and wood and paint for the carpentry.

The challenge she faces is lack of money to invest in farming and in carpentry.

Her dream is to be able to have a house of her own and to give schooling to her children.

In her free time she likes to read, play with her children and enjoy the festivities of the Virgen Santa Rita and of the canton.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, wood and paint.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 34 años, vive en unión libre,no tiene hijos y vive con su compañera de hogar en una aldea rural del Municipio de Morazán, Yoro.
Andrés manifiesta que le gusta mucho la vida del campo (área rural). Desde joven sus padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra. Se siente motivado porque hace 3 años dispone de una parcela de terreno en donde cultiva café. El produce café pergamino húmedo el cual vende en el mercado local a un precio considerable.   El como todo un buen  agricultor conoce las labores que debe realizar y siempre esta pendiente del mantenimiento que requiere el cultivo.  
Andrés necesita un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras el cual solicito a ODEF para comprar urea y abono para el mantenimiento de la finca de café.  Con esto espera ampliar su nivel de producción y obtener más ganancias.
Du meta es seguir produciendo y fortaleciendo sus cultivos cada año para tener siempre una rentabilidad económica para que su familia goce de una mejor vida sin dificultades económicas.
texts.en:
Andrés, 34, is in a common law relationship.  He has no children and lives with his spouse in a rural village in Morazán Municipality, Yoro.

Andrés states that he likes life in the countryside (rural area) very much.  Since he was young his father taught him to work the land.  He feels motivated because he’s had a parcel of land for the last three years where he grows coffee.  He produces “wet parchment” coffee [specialty coffee] that he sells in the local market for a considerable price.  Like all good farmers, he knows the tasks he must do and is always watchful to provide his crops with the maintenance they need.

Andrés needs a 7,000 lempira loan he asked ODEF for to buy urea and manure to provide maintenance to his coffee farm.  He hopes with this to expand production level and obtain more profits.

His goal is to continue producing and strengthening his crops each year to always obtain economic profits so that his family can enjoy a better life free of economic problems.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo ya que se dispone a trabajar en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol para esto necesita comprarse abono y pagar mano de obra a quienes le ayudan a realizar el trabajo el espera iniciar este cultivo con todos los materiales necesarios.
Con el préstamo anterior logro salir con una buena cosecha de maíz ayudando a su familia ya que con esta producción logro realizar algunas ventas y esos ingresos fueron realizados en las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Gilberto is asking for a new loan because he’s intending to work in agriculture planting corn and beans and to do so needs to buy manure and to pay those who will help him  do the work; he expects to start this crop with all necessary supplies.

With the previous loan he managed to get a good corn harvest helping his family because he was able to do some sales with this harvest and the income produced helped with household needs.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 58-year-old married man and father of five children. In 2003, he started up his own telecommunications store, selling telephones and mobile recharging cards and providing international calls. Being a stranger to his current village of work and residence, Mohamad had a rough start. However, he succeeded in building a wide client base thanks to his experience in retail, good customer service, and strategic location.

Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua to purchase more supplies to offer at his store. With this he will be able to ensure the availability of products to his customers. Mohamad will use the money left to support his son in starting up his own recording studio.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to offer at his store.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
Maritza, quiere invertir un préstamo en materia prima para la elaboración de loza comprándose barro negro, nacazcol, leña, transporte y una parte para mano de obra, esto le ayudara para seguir produciendo ollas, comales y demás productos de barro.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo en el negocio ya que logro mantener un buen nivel de producción, de la cual obtuvo buenas ganancias, en su familia todos se mantienen igual pero en este periodo han tenido mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maritza wants to invest a loan in raw materials to make dinnerware; she will buy black clay, ‘nacazcol’ [a dye], firewood and transport and part of it will be for labor costs.  This will help her continue to make pots, griddles and other clay products.

Her previous loan helped in her business in that she managed to maintain a good production level that produced good profits for her.  Her family remains the same but during this period their income has been better.

loans.use: to buy black clay, dye, firewood and transportation.

loans.name: Eduin Nelen

texts.es:
Eduin es un hombre muy trabajador, el vive al lado de su esposa y su hijo de 17 años de edad, el cual es su razón de vivir y su motivo para salir adelante cada día; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que  se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, por ello se le denomina la tierra del sol eterno. Cuando dispone e un tiempo libre le gusta ir a su pequeña parcela a sembrar plantas o regarlas, eso lo distrae mucho y sobre todo se aleja del bullicio de la ciudad, en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Patasca”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Medicina veterinaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo Eduin trabaja en su negocio de elaboración y venta de ladrillos,  es un trabajo muy laborioso y sobre todo se debe de realizar con mucho cuidado para evitar accidentes, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 3 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo amable con los clientes.

Eduin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar unos trámites para poder inscribir su terreno en el municipio de la ciudad, de esta manera evitara que le puedan quitar su pequeño terreno por no estar inscrito y así el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder crecer en su negocio y darle una  profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Eduin is a very hard-working man. He lives with his wife and 17 year-old son, who is his reason for living and for going forward each day. His home is located in Ica, a city noted for having a warm climate at any time of year. That is why it is called the "Land of Eternal Sun". 

When he has free time, he likes to go to his small parcel of land to do planting or watering. He enjoys this a great deal, and above all, it gets him away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Sometimes he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, which is the very delicious “patasca” (a stew made with meat and hominy corn). He only went as far as high school, but would have liked to have studied veterinary medicine.

With a great deal of effort, Eduin works in his business making and selling bricks. It is very laborious work, and above all, it must be done very carefully in order to avoid accidents. He works in his business for around eight hours daily and can serve up to three customers a day. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very hard-working and above all friendly to his customers.

Eduin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to do the paperwork necessary to register his land title with the city's municipal government. This way he will avoid them being able to take away his small piece of land for not being registered. This way, he will be able to continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: ”To be able to see my business grow and help my son have a profession".

loans.use: To do the paperwork necessary to register his land title.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda es una mujer de 56 años tiene varios hijos, todos ya mayores e independientes.  Hilda cuenta con varias maquinas de coser y con ellas realiza trabajos de costura y confección de ropas para aportar una gran parte en los ingresos de la casa, complementando así los ingresos que obtiene su esposo en un taller mecánico familiar.
Se dedica a esto desde hace 5 años, dando a sus clientes un excelente servicio y también ayudando a su familia. La meta de Hilda es seguir trabajando y ser una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar insumos tales como telas hilos, encajes, etc. La señora agradece la ayuda, pues le permitirá crecer en su emprendimiento y acercarse de manera más rápida a los objetivos que se propone como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is 56 years old and has several children, all of whom are grown and independent. She has various sewing machines that she uses for her sewing and dressmaking jobs, which provide a large part of her household income. This complements the income earned by her husband, who works in a family-owned auto repair shop.

Hilda has been in this business for five years. She provides her customers with excellent service and also helps her family. Hilda's goals are to continue working and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, lace, and other items. Sra. Hilda is grateful for the assistance, which will allow her to grow in her enterprise and quickly accomplish the goals she has set for herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lace, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en un invernadero ya que con el que contaba se daño por la lluvia por lo que él quiere repararlo y sembrar mil plantas de tomate con este préstamo comprara cuartones, manta aislante para las plagas, semilla de tomate chile pepino y fertilizante.
El préstamo anterior fue de mucha ayuda para José pues obtuvo una buena producción de tomates y pepinos, sus condiciones han mejorado debido a la experiencia en el cultivo ya que le permitió proveer a los clientes del mercado su núcleo familiar se mantiene y espera seguir trabajando de la misma manera.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to invest in a nursery because the one he had was damaged by the rain; he needs to repair it and plant 1000 tomato plants.  He will use this loan to buy beams, insect netting, fertilizer and tomato, cucumber and chili seeds.

The previous loan was of much help for José because he obtained a good production of tomatoes and cucumbers.  His conditions have improved due to the experience with the crops since it allowed him to supply his market customers.  His nuclear family maintains itself and he hopes to continue working the same way.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mathwe

texts.en:
Mathwe is married and has two children who attend school.  He lives in Likoni Mombasa where he raises poultry.

Mathwe is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to boost his poultry business, purchase poultry feeds, and repair his chicken house. He cited seasonality and disease outbreak as his greatest business challenges. Mathwe dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of chicken meat in the future. Mathwe lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and repair his chicken house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of ingredients such as rice and sugar to prepare his drinks, and also to purchase meat and dairy products.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento de su negocio comprándose al por mayor leña y maíz, que son los materiales utilizados para la venta de tortillas. Esto será un beneficio para María pues los precios serán menores al comprarse por mayor cantidad, lo que le dará la oportunidad de tener un mejor margen de ganancia.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior a permanecido en el negocio, pues su compra de insumos le ayudo mucho para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas, gracias a esto su familia cuenta con lo necesario para subsistir.
texts.en: María has decided to take out a new loan in order to strengthen her business by buying firewood and corn, which are the materials used to sell tortillas, in bulk. This will benefit her because buying wholesale means buying at lower prices and is thus an opportunity to increase her profits. She tells us that with her previous loan she was able to remain in business, since buying the materials she needed helped her immensely to keep making tortillas. Thanks to that, her family can have the basic necessities needed to survive.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has three children who attend school. For the past five years, she has operated a café business.  Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby.

Susan is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a freezer to store food products for her café business. She joined Yehu to access financial services.  She dreams of owning another outlet in town in the future.  Susan lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rental bills and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to store food products for her café business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice used her previous loan to buy farm inputs, which made her get a very good harvest. She has now applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use for purchasing more farm inputs for better harvest. She intends to use the profit to improve her horticultural farming business for sale and be a horticultural farmer.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Santiago, vive junto a su madre y un hermano, el es un comerciante administra una tienda de productos domésticos vende comida y cosméticos por medio de catálogos con esto apoya a su familia y ellos le colaboran para atender a sus clientes.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como azúcar, embutidos, pastas, jabón, detergente, productos de higiene personal, con este préstamo quiere fortalecer el negocio ya que esto le asegurara un desarrollo frente a sus cliente.
La aspiración de Santiago es crecer con su negocio para ayudar a su madre y a su hermano y poder también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santiago lives with his mother and brother. He is a merchant who manages a household products store where he sells food and cosmetics through catalogs. This business supports his family and they all help each other with attending to the customers.

Santiago is requesting a loan in order to buy products for his store such as sugar, sausages, pastas, soap, detergent, and personal hygiene products. He wants to use this loan to strengthen and secure the development of his business. His aspiration is to grow his business so that he can help his mother and brother and also improve their home.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sausages, pastas, soap, detergent, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Odalma Lisseth

texts.es:
Odalma, solicita un nuevo préstamo para el mejoramiento de su vehículo personal pues presenta algunos desperfectos mecánicos y necesita comprarse llantas, luces y un filtro con lo que espera mantener en buenas condiciones su carro, para trasladarse a su trabajo.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro realizar sus objetivos propuestos con su vehiculo y hasta el momento sus condiciones de vida están mejorando ya que en este periodo se compro el vehículo mas reciente.
texts.en:
Odalma is asking for a new loan to make improvements to her personal vehicle because it has a few mechanical problems and she needs to buy tires, lights and a filter that she hopes will keep her car in good conditions so that she can drive to work.

She states that with the previous loan  she was able to meet then goals she’d set with her vehicle and to date her living conditions are improving since in this period she purchased a newer model vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires, lights and a filter.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos que utiliza para elaborar los refrescos comprándose bolsas plásticas, frutas y algunos refrescos artificiales, con los cuales estará realizando la venta, también quiere invertir una parte para reparar las instalaciones de un cuarto.
El considera que tubo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, ya que le permitió realizar las compras necesarias para superarse con su negocio, este avance le permitió generar mejores ganancias de las cuales espera a futuro realizarle mejoras a su vivienda para ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gilberto decided on a new loan to buy supplies he uses to make refreshments; he will buy plastic bags, fruit and some soft-drinks that he’ll sell.  He also wants to use part of it to repair a room.

He believes that he had a positive effect with the previous loan because it made it possible for him to make some purchases needed to improve the business.  This advance allowed him to earn better profits which he hopes in future to use to do some home improvements to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, fruit and some soft-drinks.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane/ Mgnz Group

texts.fr:
Joseph fait partie du groupe Dushyigikirane /Mgnz. Le nom du groupe signifie «aider l’un à l’autre». Il a 45 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 2 ans à 18 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Il a 2 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Joseph est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autres crédits et utiliser des fertilisants sélectionner. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait modernise son agriculture en achetant des machines. Avec les profits, il prévoit de, payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Joseph is a member of the group Dushyigikirane /Mgnz. The name of the group means “to help one another”. Joseph, age 45, is married with six children aged 2 to 18, four of whom go to school. In addition to his family, he has two other dependents in his care. He attended six years of primary school. 

Joseph is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.  

Joseph plans to expand his activity by obtaining additional loans and using selected fertilizers. In the coming years, he would like to upgrade his operations by acquiring modern technology. He will use the profits earned to pay for his children’s tuition and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
El Sr. Catalino de 50 años de edad, está casado con  la señora Romelia de 44 años, tienen tres hijos quienes estudian y sueñan con ser grandes profesionales.
Don Catalino se dedica a la venta de remedios y  también tiene un pequeño copetín,  hace más de 21 años aproximadamente que él se dedica a esto. Comenzó con un pequeño capital, que obtuvo de la venta de una moto, instalándose así con un mostrador de madera en una de la esquina más concurrida de la ciudad, es por eso que su local es muy conocido y concurrido, con una gran clientela formada. El es una persona muy sacrificada, y ha mostrado que con trabajo se puede salir adelante.
Este crédito lo solicita para comprar gaseosas, comestibles, galletitas, golosinas y demás artículos para poder surtir su copetín y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sr. Catalino is 50 years old and married to Sra. Romelia, age 44. They have three children who are studying and dreaming about becoming successful professionals.

Don Catalino sells remedies, but he also has a small snack bar that he established more than 21 years ago. He started out with a small amount of capital he obtained after selling a motorcycle. Catalino set up a wooden stand on one of the busiest and most well-known street corners of the city. He was able to form a large customer base. Catalino is a self-sacrificing person who has demonstrated that he can get ahead as a result of his work. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy sodas, snacks, cookies, candy, and other items to restock his snack bar, which will allow him to continue working.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, cookies, candy, and other items.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past five years Roda has sold secondhand clothes at the local market to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is her major business challenge.

Roda decided to join Yehu to access its loans. She is applying for a 10,000 KES loan to buy bales of children’s clothes to sell. Roda’s ambition is to sell bed sheets as well.

loans.use: to buy bales of children’s clothes to sell.

loans.name: Myryan Yaninna

texts.es:
Myryan es una joven muy emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad en la cual se destaca por su población de origen afroperuano, es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen. Cuando se siente preocupada o cansada él su esposo le da muchos ánimos, es su mano derecha y su mejor amigo.

 Myryan se dedica a la repostería, vende dulces, gelatinas, tortas alfajores, bocaditos, recorre las calles de su barrio ofreciendo sus dulces pero no solo se dedica a ello sino también vende gas domestico, en su casa, Myryan es muy trabajadora, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que prepara de una manera muy deliciosa sus dulces y porque es muy ordenada y le gusta la limpieza por ello los clientes se animan a comprar su productos, además de que le gusta tratar de manera amable a los clientes y lo más importante que prepara sus postres con mucho cariño.

 Myryan está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y gracias a esta ayuda, ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para poder conservar mejor sus postres y que estos no se malogren; con ello tendrá más ingresos para así poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, así como también ahorrar para mejorar para cumplir su gran sueño:” Crecer como Microempresaria”
texts.en:
Myryan is a young entrepreneur living in the city of Chincha, a city that stands out because of its Afro-Peruvian population.  It is the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes and has beautiful beaches.  The city is also very well-known for its cuisine because people in this city are known for preparing very tasty dishes.  When she feels worried or tired her husband encourages her very much; he’s her right hand and her best friend.

Myryan is a pastry maker; she sells sweets, gelatin, sesame sponge cakes and snacks.  She goes throughout her neighborhood’s streets offering her sweets but this isn’t all she does; she also sells domestic gas at home.  Myryan is very hardworking.  She spends about 9 hours daily at work.  She believes that she does well in her business because she prepares her sweets in a very delicious way and because she’s very organized and likes cleanliness which is why customers are encouraged to buy her products.  In addition, she treats them kindly and the most important thing though is that she prepares her desserts with much love.

Myryan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they’ve given her their support and thanks to this help she will be able to buy a refrigerator to better store her desserts so that they won’t spoil.  With this she’ll have more income to continue investing in her business as well as to save up to improve to attain her greatest dream: to grow as a micro businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es:
Doña Isidora tiene 53 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos, y vive con su esposo en una aldea del municipio de Jesús de Otoro, Lempira.
Isidora es una mujer muy activa y reconocida en la comunidad forma grupos para trabajar, ella tiene 12 años de realizar actividades agrícolas junto a su esposo principalmente al cultivo de café. Vende café en grano y también lo procesa, lo vende molido y empacado a los  negocios o pulperías.
ya ha solicitado varios prestamos anteriormente a ODEF para su negocio, actualmente solicita el noveno préstamo por LPs.10,000.00, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes y abonos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y también para pago de mano de obra por limpieza de la misma, ya que es su fuente de ingresos y necesitan mantenerla bien cuidada.
Su objetivo de seguir trabajando es para mejorar el nivel de vida tanto personal como familiar.

Ella forma parte de grupo solidario Ojo de Agua, que está formado por 4 integrantes que se dedican al cultivo de café y viven en la misma comunidad. en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda el Sr. Claros, seguido Isidora, luego María y a la derecha Claros Antonio. A nivel grupal solicitan LPS. 37,000.00.
texts.en:
Isidora, 53, is married and has three children; she lives with her husband in a village in the municipality of Jesús de Otoro, Lempira.

Isidora is a very active woman who is well-known in her community; she organizes work groups.  She’s been working in agriculture for 12 years with her husband; they mainly grow coffee.  She sells the coffee beans and also processes it and sells it ground and packaged to businesses or grocery stores.

She has asked ODEF for several previous loans for her business and is currently asking for her 9th loan in the amount of 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and manure for coffee crop maintenance and also to pay labor costs to clear the fields since this is her source of income and they need to keep it well cared for.  Her objective in continuing to work is to improve her and her family’s standard of living.

She belongs to the “Ojo de Agua” communal bank that has four members who grow coffee and live in the same community.  In the photo they can be identified thus: to the left is Carlos followed by Isidora then María and on the right is Carlos Antonio.  At the group level, they are requesting 37,000 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Tubumwe Mubikorwa / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Tubumwemubikorwa. Le nom du groupe signifie «Tous ensemble  ». Il a 55 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 15 ans à 35 ans. Il a 2 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autres crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait modernise son agriculture en achetant des machines. Avec les profits, il prévoit de, payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the group Tubumwe/Mubikorwa Rsz. The name of the group means “all together”. Jean, age 55, is married with five children aged 15 to 35. He supports two people other than his children. He attended six years of primary school. 

Jean is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.  

Jean plans to expand his activity by obtaining additional loans. In the coming years, he would like to upgrade his operations by acquiring modern machinery. He will use the profits earned to pay for his children’s tuition and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has four children. For the past six years he has sold clothes to earn a living. His business has grown since he joined Faulu Kenya because he was trained in business management skills. He has one employee.

Peter has requested a 60,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. He hopes to grow his business and employ more people.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has two children who attend school. For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business in the future. She lives in a rental house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is married and has two children.  He sells bedsheets, duvets, and blankets to earn a living.  He employs one person in the business.  Gerald also operates a mobile-phone-money transfer business to earn extra income.  

Gerald is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to buy bedsheets, duvets, and blankets.  He has expanded his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  He hopes to expand his business and hire more people.

loans.use: to purchases bedsheets, duvets, and blankets.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia, residente de la ciudad de Cartagena, madre de dos hijos en las edades de 25 y de 26 años, se dedica al tradicional arte de la confección. Ella con esa actividad ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, pues justamente empezó a estudiar este oficio una vez se separó de su esposo, con el fin de lograr independencia económica y sostener con condiciones de bienestar a sus dos hijos, a quienes ha logrado dar educación profesional para que en un futuro logren tener éxito; Ofelia tuvo su primer  financiamiento  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace un año; con él ha logrado tener su vivienda propia y muchos sueños de prosperidad, En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que planea comprar materias primas e insumos, para fabricar uniformes que le han encargado algunas instituciones educativas y necesita hacer compras en mayor volumen y ganar buenos descuentos, para hacer una oferta competitiva. Pues su meta mas adelante es lograr su posicionamiento en el mercado, contratar operarias y dedicarse a la administración de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ofelia lives in the city of Cartagena; she’s the mother of two children who are 25 and 26 years old.  She works in the traditional art of dressmaking.  With this activity she’s generated income to support her household because she started learning this occupation precisely when she separated from her husband and needed to attain economic independence and to support her two children’s wellbeing who she’s managed to provide professional education to so that they can be successful in the future.

Ofelia got her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo financing a year ago and with it managed to acquire her own house and to attain many of her dreams for prosperity.  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan she plans to use to buy raw materials and supplies to manufacture uniforms some schools have ordered and she needs to make purchases in large volume to earn good discounts so that her offer will be competitive. Her goal for later on is to attain good market position, to hire employees and to dedicate herself to running her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to manufacture uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, powders and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phone recharges and to start a food stall business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, biscuits,  and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for sewing thread, packing needle, sofa wrapping material, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past twenty years she has operated a beauty salon. In addition, she has a farm and owns and rents houses, all of which contribute to her family’s income.

Susan decided to join Yehu because of its fair policies. With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, she will buy seed and pay for having her fields plowed. Susan dreams of diversifying her businesses to make more in profits.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for having her fields plowed.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia, 38, is a mother of four children: Yoseph, 18; Ignas, 13; Petra 7; Clara, 6.  All of them are still at school.  In order to meet their family needs, Cornelia sells kerosene while her husband serves as a motor-taxi driver.  They work hard to provide a better life for their family.  Cornelia would like to increase the income generated through selling kerosene and to pay the educational costs of her lovely children.  Therefore, Cornelia is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Rupiah (IDR).  She plans to spend the loan on more kerosene and on her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy kerosene and for pay for the children's educational expenses

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es:
Dolores, quiere surtir el negocio comprándose por ejemplo tomates, cebolla, aguacates, manzanas, uvas entre otras frutas y verduras que son demandadas por lo clientes, su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, pues es su única fuente de trabajo para poder salir adelante.
El préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo al negocio, surtiéndole y aumentando sus ventas y las ganancias que hasta el momento le ha permitido mantener en su familia todo lo necesario para la alimentación, así como también estar solvente de todas sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Dolores would like to restock her business by purchasing, for example, tomatoes, onions, avocados, apples and grapes among other fruits and vegetables that are in demand by her customers. Her goal is to maintain her business, which is her only source of work which helps her to get ahead. 

Her previous loan affected her business positively, allowing her to restock and increase her sales. Her income allows her to take care of her family by purchasing food. She is also free from any other financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, avocados, apples and grapes.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 39-year-old woman and is married to Morits, a 43-year-old man.  They have three children, namely: Gerald, 13, a disabled child; Gilbert, 11, who is attending sixth grade of primary school; and Gres, 10, who is attending the fifth grade of primary school.  

Debora is a kerosene supplier.  She started the business in 2006. In addition to selling kerosene, Debora used to run a kiosk business which was stopped for a while due to the lack of capital.  Debora would like to continue the kiosk business and therefore requested a loan of 10,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM.  She would like to spend the loan on more containers to store kerosene and she also would like to buy her kiosk stocks, i.e.: instant noodles, eggs, rice, snacks, cigarettes, etc.

loans.use: to buy more containers to store kerosene and to buy several kiosk items i.e. instant noodles, eggs, rice, snacks, cigarettes.

loans.name: Sriance

texts.en:
Sriance is a 36-year-old woman, and is married to Dominggus, a 40-year-old man.  They have been blessed with two children, namely: Rezaldy, who is 13 years old and is attending the first grade of junior high school; and Yayang, who's 6 years old and is attending sixth grade of primary school.  

Sriance used to run many businesses, i.e. a pig breeding business, a vegetables retailer, and a mat retailer in order to fulfill her living cost and her children's educational expenditures.  

At the moment Sriance would like to only focus on expanding her mat retail business.  She therefore submitted a loan application and requested a loan of 3,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM to purchase mats in big quantities.  She plans to resell them to other mat retailers who sell the product at the harbor.  She hopes that she can expand the business through the loan.

loans.use: to buy mats in big quantities

loans.name: Hajral

texts.en:
Hajral is a 40-year-old single man. He has been running a kiosk business for eight years to provide for his living costs. He uses an empty room as a kiosk. Basic daily items are available at his kiosk such as detergents, shampoo, snacks and candies. 
Hajral would like to add more variety of stock and improve his kiosk business by offering PlayStation games rental, but the profit he currently generates is not sufficient to support his plan. Hajral heard that Kiva partner TLM can help him by providing a business loan. He submitted a loan application requesting a loan of 12,000,000 IDR from TLM. This loan will be used to buy more stock, e.g. rice, wheat flour, cigarettes, snacks etc. for his kiosk and to buy three PlayStation units and televisions. He is sure that the improvement of his business will bring benefits to him in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock, e.g. rice, wheat flour, cigarettes, snacks etc. for his kiosk and to buy three PlayStation units and televisions.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a rental that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past three years Esther has run a secondhand clothes business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her main business challenge is theft.

Esther decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With the 50,000 KES loan she is requesting she wants to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more adult's and children's second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en: Sada is taking out another Kiva loan of 60,000 KES to boost her business. With this loan she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Sada is grateful to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Unidas" esta en el ciclo nº 21,  mantienen el grupo con un excelente comportamiento, todas ellas son muy amigas y siempre se ayudan y trabajan juntas para poder de esa forma crecer juntas.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es seguir trabajando y fomentar el espiritu solidario y mantener la unidad del grupo.
La sra. Obdulia es la Presidenta del grupo desde el inicio del comité, ella junto a sus demas compañeras  y gracias a la ayuda de la fundacion paraguaya y sus capacitaciones han podido mejorar muchos sus vidas. La Sra. Obdulia se dedica a la venta de comida de todo tipo, y es gracias a este trabajo y a su sacrificio que ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas communal bank is in its twenty-first cycle.  They support the group with excellent performance.  All of them are good friends and they always help each other and work together so they can grow together.  The goal of each one of them is to continue working, to encourage a spirit of solidarity, and to support the unity of the group.

Obdulia has been the president of the group since the bank began.  She got the other members together and, thanks to the help from Fundación Paraguaya and its training, they have been able to get ahead and help their families.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients with which she will continue making the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is married and lives in Likoni, Mombasa with her family. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six months Uba has raised chickens and sold them from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the potential for disease in her flock.

Uba joined Yehu to access loans for her business. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to buy chicken feed and a feeding trough. Her ambition is to become a major poultry supplier.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and a feeding trough.

loans.name: Kurera

texts.en:
Kurera is married with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past three years, Kurera has operated a barber shop business, working in a shop and serving his neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of power shortages in his business. Kurera dreams of expanding his business to meet his customers' needs. 
With his loan of 40,000 KES he wants to purchase an electric razor for his business. He decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase an electric razor for his business.

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es: La historia empresarial de Mónica inició, cuando trabajando en un almacén de calzado por muchos años, en jornadas agobiantes y sin tiempo para dedicarse a sus hijos, quienes requerían una mayor atención, decidió renunciar de su empleo y emprender su propia aventura de negocios,   aprovechando su  experiencia pasada en el mercado. Fue así como apoyada por un proveedor empezó a vender calzado, bolsos y ropa a crédito y así mismo en plazos de 3 meses, pagaba a su proveedor, quien fue su primer apoyo en esta decisión. Gradualmente su clientela fue creciendo y sus opciones de compra se incrementaron, logrando ensanchar su lista de proveedores como hoy, que cuenta con estos en otras  ciudades del país como  Barranquilla y Bucaramanga.    Su meta es disponer de un capital de trabajo suficiente, para ella misma hacer compras de productos de oportunidad, que brinda el mercado   en estas ciudades, cuando hay dinero disponible. Su mayor desafío es lograr que ante la creciente demanda de su mercado,  tenga un capital de trabajo suficiente para responderle oportunamente a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprara directamente calzado y bolsos elaborados en cuero y que están justificados en pedidos de sus clientes rentables, lo cual hace que esta financiación tenga un gran potencial de éxito.
texts.en:
